content:
Posted: April 9, 2015
												First time I felt the need to write a review.  This game is truly satisfying if you're a competition junky. You don't even have to like sport games to enjoy this game.  The gameplay and game mechanics all work well, untill that point where you hit level 24. As a beginner, I started out playing against other noobs and various pro players that had their smurf accounts in the rookie/major league. I had some epic losses, epic victories, various intense close point games that went into second overtime. Eventually, I managed to get to level 25 with a 76% win percentage overall, I felt like a solid player that played his role ( PF ) well. In good matches, I'd block about every shot, bad matches I'd let a few slide.   All the fun in the game stopped though when I entered the  Pro League.Match after match, you get to play against level 50 characters that not only have the most ridiculous skills that you could think, they also have so much experience that not in another 1000 matches could you hope to destroy them. They also have, in almost EVERY case, dropped over 200-300 euros on cash shop roulette style items that grant bonus stats, cards and card upgrades that grant..bonus stats, extra skill slots, etc.  You name it.So in quick summary. You might love the game in the beginning, you might think you're a genius rookie player destroying the alt characters of pros. But once you actually get to the pro league, prepare to bend over and take it, over and over again untill you yourself are level 44-50 and have unlocked all the skills + slots. Surely by that time, you would also have dropped atleast 60 euros on the game.

content:
Posted: April 8, 2015
												Bear with me as this is my first game review on Steam:Pros:- Great customization (Skills, Freestyle variability, Clothing, Stat allocation)- Requires teamwork (Heavy)- Crew matches (Like GvG in MMORPGs)- Easy to pick up, Hard to masterCons:- Community can be toxic (Will explain more later)- You can pay for stats- Fluid gameplay relies heavily on latency (ping)Freestyle2 is a great Multiplayer Online 3v3 Streetball game that pleases my thirst for basketball games.It is very easy to pick up (You only use direction keys + 4 basic keys + 2 or 3 more for specific skills),but hard to master.It relies moderately on basketball knowledge, such as actual basketball tactics like Pick and Roll, which can be executed in the right situation. To win, you will have to try your best to fulfill your one of five (C, PF, SF, SG, PG) position's purpose.Positions and their roles are generalized in FreeStyle2, although adventurous stat allocation may lead to fun and creative plays (like improving 3 pointers success rate on C or PFs). C: Rebounding and blocking, setting up plays under the paintPF: Similar to C, but takes an offensive roleSF: All-rounder (Dunk, rebound, middle jumper, 3s)SG: Also an all-rounder with heavier emphasis on 3sPG: Playmaker (Passing and loose ball grabbing)Playing the position that fits you and doing it right comes with a great rewarding feeling.Also, there are many team compositions which are strong, but you will run into hell lot of weird ones online (Triple Cs)If you aren't good at what your position is supposed to be doing by Major (past level 11), you will most likely be dealt with offensive words, telling you that you suck and that you should quit.The playerbase isn't large enough to have the greatest matchmaking system and tiers - and this is why sometimes you will face teams that will totally♥♥♥♥♥♥on your face. Knowing your position and having individual skills is very important in this game and when a single teammate is not pulling their own weight, it shows definitely. I highly suggest trying each of the 5 positions before moving onto Major (level 11+)You can pay for extra stats (btw you can also do this for free, but not as much). Does it help? Yeah, I guess.Does it win games? Maybe - it makes minimal difference.Why is that?Let's say a player purchased items and also obtained cards to improve his 3 pointers.If you are guarding him perfectly, he won't score any 3 pointers.If you don't and give him open shots on 3s, you should really blame yourself.Teamwork (Strategy, Individual talent, knowing how each other reacts in certain situations) is much much much much holy freaking so much more important and impactful than stats.Gamekiss will be adding controller support very soon, and I am so excited for that!Give this game a try. If you like working as a team and enjoy basketball in general, you will love it!

content:
Posted: April 12, 2015
												Bear in mind that this review comes from a person who used to play Freestyle 1 a lot of years ago. I've played in Thailand servers, in Gamekiss (NA) servers, in 4Game (Russian) servers and my country always had a big community in this game because we are big on basketball. There will be a lot of comparingBefore my rant, remember: I HATE BASKETBALL.Yes, I hate basketball. I've played this game for so long (the Freestyle 1 version) even though I hate basketball. You know why? Because this game is super fun even if you don't know anything about basketball. There is constant action, it's super rewarding to block, rebound and when you hit a 3-pointer, it's the best feeling ever.Freestyle 1 was actually rather bad.It was full P2W, clothes that give attributes were all costing money, the OP moves that were difficult to block were all expensive and you HAD to buy them with real life money. There were serveral exploits like when you receive a pass, you get a speedboost. Exploiting that, you could always step back faster than your opponent and make yourself unblockable. Level system was awful, you only got your real position at level 15 and the grind to 45 (max level) was like the whole game. High level people could do anything and everything so you had to block them every time because they would hit every shot. You know why that was awful? That's right, the speed boost exploit.Freestyle 2 possibly improves every mechanic that existsted in FSSB1. Skills costs like 3k at the start, meanwhile you get like 50k points at the start by registering, eliminating the grinding element of the game. Freestyles (Skills that only makes your shot/dunk different, making it harder to be blocked) can now be used only once or twice per game because you have to meet the requirements to do them. However, once you do them, it's garanteed points, so I think that's a nice touch. You choose freestyles on your own, instead of them spinning in the exact same order for the whole game. Music is constantly playing in game, making you feel in action. Also, the soundtrack makes you super pumped, while you can also configure it FSSB1 Games were all the same: PFs/Cs rebound, pass it to SGs and they shoot 3points OR PFs just dunking and you can't block them because they have paid for the awesome almost unblockable dunks. In FSSB2, or at least in early stages of FSSB2, it won't be like this. SGs can be blocked easily, there are way more rebound patterns for rebounders to learn, etc. Bigger skill variety Can be played with a controller. I haven't tried it yet, but I think it might be really fun Awesome rewarding system, making you feel progressing, most daily quests  aren't considered grinding and there are constant events. You also constantly get items and a lot of points, also making the game not P2W EVEN IF YOU DON'T LIKE BASKETBALL, YOU WILL ENJOY THIS GAME It's super rewarding. I watched a streamer play it with friends in front of 13k thousand viewers yesterday and he had a blast, meanwhile not even knowing that you can't shoot while you are getting defended by someone. He still had fun, I saw the excitement in his eyes meanwhile he was watching whether  the ball will go into the basket or not.  ALSO, IT'S SUPER FUN TO PLAY WITH FRIENDSEven if you dislike basketball, dislike sports games like I do, you might still have a blast. It might still be super fun for you, or at least fun for 3-10 hours. You have nothing to lose, it's  free to play. Grab some friends, put your game pants and gunnars and go play it! This game is awesome and the devs definitely stepped up their game, adding new elements and improving  the old ones.

content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												I've been playing Freestyle for 7 long years. Since I was 12 years old, Freestyle has been my favorite game.It has been with me throughout all my teenage years, and I don't regret a thing.Ever since it first came out in 2006 (published by Activision), the game has had issues maintaining a good population due to lack of advertising and support from the foreign developers (JCE).That's all hopefully going to change now that it has been released on Steam. It's a shame how we had to wait so many years for this because this is one of the most competitive games in the world.Everybody who plays this game strives to ultimately be the best, and it's a team game so you have to find 2 other players who share the same mindset as you and want to be the best just as bad as you are.A lot of this game consists of managing egos of not only your rivals, but your teammates also.There is only one ball in the game of basketball, and scoring is only one part of it.You have to have a good overall team that can not only score, but rebound, defend, block, steal, and pass at the right times.This game is all about customization and making your player unique. There is a big item shop in the game that allows you to buy headgear,tops,bottoms, shoes, and accesories to make your baller look unique.There are also Freestyles that allow you to change basic animations like dunks and shots so you can turn your simple one handed dunk in to a crazy 360 between the legs dunk!Then you have your skills. Skills are new animations and upgrades you unlock through leveling your character.Skills are the most important part of the game since they give really useful animations like diving for the ball or fading away.When you first start the game and you go in to Rookies, you will be playing versus new players such as yourself who are also learning the game and it will be a cake walk for those who learn faster than others.Beware though, there is a huge learning curve when you reach the big leagues (PRO Channel).People do NOT like losing in Pros because it will result in their win % going down and the person that beat you having proof of them beating you.I was never a guy to make many friends on this game, in fact I made a lot more enemies than I did friends and I am very hated but my advice to you new players is, make some friends before you reach Pros.Try your hardest to communicate and socialize, post on the forums. MAKE FRIENDS. You do not want to be that "random" "unknown" person in Pros because nobody knows you and you will be kicked out of teams that have good players when you try to join because they simply don't know you.You will be stuck on the "Noob Treadmill". That means you will be stuck playing only with players who are really bad and don't care who they play with, and other unknown players like you are which means you will lose A LOT and people will never see you as good.So make friends before you get to pros! Get your name out there.If you pick up this game and decide you like it and you're either a PG,PF,or C then you can add my character in game, I will help you. My IGN is: ZarrySo yeah, that is it for my long review and although my time on this game is coming to an end, I am happy it is finally getting the exposure it deserves because I know theres a kid out there right now maybe even reading this whos 12 or 13 years old that will fall in love with this game and aspire to be the very best player just like I did.Good look in the pros, newbs.

number of helpful: 40 of 51 people (78%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 12, 2015
												Having played this game for quite some time this is how I feel about it:Positive:+ It's fun: Seriously, the game is really fun.+ Has a nice mixture of simplicity and complexity: The game is easy to get into, the controllers are kind of basic but it has a high skill cap, it's hard to master them.+ Character Costumization: It's really nice.+ The game has tons of features to keep you entertained: Bingo, My Ball, Freestyles, Challenges, etc.+ It's rewarding to play: The achievement system combined with Bingo, My Ball, Freestyles, etc. makes you feel like a winner even when you're losing, so there's some reward in actually playing the game, even if you're not that good at it and just like playing it for the sake of having fun.+ MVP: MVP rewards the player that contributes more for the team instead of the one that just scores all the time. Maybe it could be a bit more balanced, but it's nice to see the game reward team play.Ofcourse there are negative points too.Negative:- Paying actually makes you better: Or atleast makes you seem like you are. Paid characters, like Ginger, for example, WILL punish you if you make a mistake, they are deadly because of the bonus they are given. Maybe in higher levels of gameplay that becomes less noticeable, but in lower levels it's really noticeable, they barely miss. And also there are skill slots unlockable by paying, and that gives more options to people that pay to unlock them, giving them an advantage over free plays. I'll put this on capslock: THE GAME IS NOT FULLY PAY TO WIN. That's not what I'm saying here! What I'm saying is the feeling that I got, that if you're a free player and paying against a paid character in a similar player skill level it's more likeable that he will easily punish your mistakes thanks to the character he has than you are likely to punish is, since you don't have as much stats and special bonus as he has.- Matchmaking is... weird: I dont know how matchmaking works on this game, but more than a few times I got to play against players that you could see by the skills they were using that they were atleast 10 levels above the players on my team. And I also felt the reverse on some games, that I was being matched with people levels below. Most of the time it felt fine, but I think it was like 80/20, so I thought it would be worth to mention.- Menus: Menus can be a bit confusing for newer players, since they are presented with a huge BOOM of stuff.- Clarity: The game isn't very clear on some stuff. For example, I had to go google for quite a bit of time why I couldn't level any stat after putting 5 points into it and the game doesn't tell you what keys to use on your controller, so even if it supports it, it's kind of better to play on the keyboard. That kind of stuff.Overall it's a good and fun game. I recommend it, even if you don't like basketball that much, give it a shot and try to bring your friends to play it with you, only makes it more fun. I'm curious to see the game evolve, since It's kind of new, from what I've read.

content:
Posted: April 4, 2015
												This is the same FreeStyle Street Basketball MMO under new management with a re-touched coat of paint and 5-10 extra ways to get you to spend money on items you don't actually want.Pros:-Fresh, vibrant artstyle-Arcade style gameplay-Decent Customization options-Well-organized lobbies ranked by skill level-Bot support-Clan supportCons:-Annoying community-Sketchy connection issues (On my first FSBB2 session, I was dropped from a game loading screen no less than 7 times in a row)-Puzzling sound direction (I don't necessarily mind the Korean rap, but the voice acting leaves a bit to be desired)-Too many unnecessary features. Booster cards, gachapon-style power-ups, robots that shout nice things and return balls for you after each shot in practice, a post-game breakdown that pats you on the back and lets you pick a mystery card: basically, every smoke-and-mirrors parlor trick mobile game designers have tried to implement into one gaudy, bedazzled cardboard box.In short: yes, I found it fun. I found it fun the last time I played the same game 5 years ago. There isn't enough improvement here for me to specifically recommend the game to any of my friends, especially not the ones who abandoned the game with me last time. I was expecting something different out of a sequel to a game that already had glaring flaws regarding netcode and connection issues, honestly. Daily Login bonuses and fake tickets for electronic roulette prizes won't cover up the few issues that still seem to exist.

												Pros:- easy to get into with a bit of basketball knowledge- first hours are really fun- if you get good teamplayers and go on a winning streak, it is really fun but..Cons:- ..but that nearly never happens, toxic community, lot of ego players, who only spam "pass me the ball" and never pass back and insult you anyway- the game supports this ego style because being open isnt as important as individual skill and outplaying your direct opponent- simple but sometimes weird acting controls (buttons have 2-3 different functions, dunk and postgame for example), different results in same spots and blocks and rebounds seem a lot like coin flips most of time, or i didn't play long enough to understand the mechanics.- lags are a huge issue, a lot of players warp around the court and score or rebound or get lose balls without the game even showing anything. it just happens.- terrible UI, lots of bugs, long loading times, the game hides a lot of information for example skills and stats of other players, which i guess is intended because..- .. massive P2W, you can buy toys, cards, skills, freestyles and clothing with bonus stats- no real matchmaking, you could get a team of 3 Cs who just afk or a perfect P2W team with a 5 game winning streak, both games are going to be no fun at all.Summary:It really has a lot of potential and could be fun, but the issues and the community are just to bad to keep playing it for longer.

content:
Posted: March 9
												This is from the perspective of a new player - i've played a couple hours or so of FSBB2 and here's my honest review. PROS: It's essentially 3-on-3 basketball. If you love basketball as a sport and as a game, this right here is it!  Simple at the start, gets more complex as you gain levels and "skills". This includes player skill as well as actual skills that you buy for your character ingame.  Additionally, customization is great. Loads of costumes, the ability to pick your skills to do stunts with, as well as "freestyle" skills, which you can think of as EX moves which use meter in fighting games;  do enough in a match and they become available for you to use. Cards are also a part of customization, you can load up cards that help you with certain statistics. On level up, you get to distribute points to certain characteristics as well, further making your character truly unique. Positions function as classes in this game. There're primarily offensive positions and defensive positions, as well as assist positions. All of them are viable, though some are more preferred than others. This gives some distinction between characters but as mentioned in the previous point, you can make your character have strengths that are adverse to contemporary assumptions. (A 3-pt shooting center? Why not?) Personal preference, but I like the aesthetic and music. It's fitting with the style of FSBB2.CONS:Oh dear, here we go. Perhaps the most destructive aspect of the game is the community. Predominantly filled with Filipino, Thai, and Indonesian players, English fails to become the primary language in this game. The community is very exclusive in nature, and unless you're part of their culture, you'll be isolated and alienated. Furthermore, many players are extremely toxic in nature, playing the game only to win. They'll personally admonish weaker players as soon as they make a mistake, and they take absurd pride in their own abilities even though they make mistakes as well. You wanna destroy a multiplayer game? This exclusive, toxic-filled community is how your game dies.  Pay-to-win. If you're a F2P player, be prepared to lose. A lot. Unless your team has veteran players or Pay2Win players, there's absolutely a slim margin chance of you ever beating your opponent, especially if they're Pay2Play. The greatest example I can give is that basic stats become skyrocketed the moment you have buffed equipment on. These equipment buffs are equivalent to around 30ish player levels at least, and that's not including the card and pet system as well. Between players of equal skill, the one with P2P equipment will always, ALWAYS win. That's just the nature of the beast. You'll be outrebounded, out blocked, out scored (your blocks will become ineffective).  Lack of a "skill-less" channel. You know, the above point can be completely circumvented by the addition of one simple thing - channels that remove all additional buff stats (but lets everyone keep a set number of skills). With this, everyone can play on an equal level. People will be forced to play with others outside their circle and the community will be more accepting. The only drawback with this server is that GameKiss will fail to make any form of profit from it. Who doesn't want to be overpowered? This is a stretch - but recent games like Overwatch have added special "swear filters" that replace the swear words with text to bemean the aggressor. A lack of such a system here (seriously, does anyone even use the report function) allows players to be as toxic and as horrible as they want without any repercussions. To be honest, I cannot see myself even reaching level 50 in this game with the current drawbacks. As I level more, the players become more unforgiving and loathing. It's embarassing to even be associated with them and their culture - I routinely kick toxic players from my team even though they may be performing well and giving me wins.I do love this game, and I can spend HOURS practicing my skillsets on my own - it's just that as a multiplayer game, the community is absolute garbage and leaves me wanting nothing more. Food for thought: why is it that SEA communities are always incredibly idiotic and taxing to play with? Most of them are asshats and ruin the multiplayer experience for everybody.

												Been playing this game since release, and played way back since Freestyle 1 when Sierra own the game, still overall fun and enjoyable, don't really care much if it's pay to win, It's fun, the graphics doesn't really matter since it's cell shaded, and overall there are tons of skills to use. When it comes to BallingIsLife™ this game still deserves the award of being fun and even if you don't like sport games, this is still an enjoyable game due to the mechanics of it and animation which I find humorous. Game was my childhood and I'm still playing it.Pros: Easy to learnFun to playLots of clothes and customizationsLots of skillsToy system is interesting to play around for statsStill feels like the old free style gamesDunking on people feels amazing!TournamentsGrowing communityCons:Pay to win *Debatable*Lots of foreign people play so teamwork is hard to communicateServers are a little unbalance from level capsLots of people sliding due to the lag of the serverReasons why I say pay to win is debatable is because I have accounts that have never touched a single cent from my wallet, and overall I am still able to win games, on my main accounts I have 85% win rates on them and played over thousands of games with them, My personal opinion it really depends on your skill level and how you play the game, because when you're playing the game, you'll see that anyone can shoot and make baskets, or defend and block shots, its really how well you play with your team and how good your offense and defense is. Overall good game, I enjoy it and Its free, so play the game.

number of helpful: 46 of 70 people (66%) found this review helpful9 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 5, 2015
												I've been playing since FSB 1 back in the Sierra days... and in my honest opinion... this game is fun but the community is one of the worst I have ever seen...The game is very fun and entertaining once you get the basics down but until then it's very frustrating playing in the rookie server with people who are selfish and doesn't know the meaning of teamwork... Some people don't realize that this game actually has a pretty steep learning curve... it's not all just shoot shoot shoot...FSB 2, similar to the 1st game, has elements of P2W but I think you can hold your own, without spending money, if you are a good enough player. If you enjoy the game, I recommend learning the basics of team-play if you want to advance any further: passing, rotating, defense, etc... like i said, it's not all just shoot shoot shoot steal steal steal...About the community... this game is sadly filled with a lot of kids who talks a lot of trash and have big egos... It's like high school all over again... everyone has their own "cliques" that they play with and will kick anyone else out (sadly, sometimes I don't blame this type of behavior because a lot of players don't bother to learn the game correctly so they become a liability to the team, therefore leading to no one wanting to play with them). I don't suggest you visit the forums of this game, especially on the gamekiss website, it's so toxic... Overall, I like the FSB series... but the horrible community and lack of competent players/teammates can make it frustrating for newcomers... If you have friends who are willing to go through the ups/downs of the game with you, I think FSB can be very enjoyable experience...

content:
Posted: August 27, 2016
												At first,when i saw the game i was like,OHMIGOD THIS LOOKS SO AWESOME I CAN'T WAIT TO DOWNLOAD THIS RIGHT NOW!Oh how wrong i was...Ok so let's start with this. This is not NBA basketball,this is street Basketball,which basically means 3v3 on one court 5 minute basketball matches,no fouls,no overtimes,no free throws. The gameplay is really fun,addictive and easy to understand,but hard to master. There are 5 classes for you to choose,plus 3 more if you want an advanced class of sorts. The game has MMORPG elements such as skills(fade away,double clutch etc)and things like tricks that can be used for doing 3pts or dunks or blocks (Twister,The Shot,etc). Plus you have a level up system,which awards with attribute points so you have better chances of doing 3pts dunks or blocks.But once you realize the faults of this game,you are better off uninstalling it.First off,the game is Pay-to-Win-ish,a F2p game for me should have at least micro-transactions for cosmetics and stuff like that,not for special characters like point guard son goku over there.Second,the game has a lot of bugs,connection issues,freezes,which need to be fix ASAP.Third,the community i say is more like CS:GO's and LOL's community long lost son who was adopted by an Asian. It's filled with ungrateful ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s,12 year old's who say that they are ♥♥♥♥ing your mom,and just toxicity all around. And it dosen't help that once you leave rookie and have an unbalance between veteran players and rookies (basically think of it as a Team of LVL 12 novices vs LVL 50 veterans)Fourth. BITCOIN MINERFifth. HACKERS. I have at least spotted 3 hackers in 3 games. If this doesn't get fixed,it will be S4 League all over again.In conclusion,without the Hackers,the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ community,the bugs,the Bitcoin Miner,and the skill gap when you leave rookie servers. This game would be better than an NBA game for at least 5 years due to it's potential.It's just the potential,is stuck under the river of cons i said.

content:
Posted: April 13, 2015
												It's fun for a bit and the game runs pretty well. I only experience small amounts of latency issues that really changed the tide of the match but it was rare. My true gripe with the game is the balancing as you level up, not so much the balance once you're at the top of level and have unlocked all the skills and attributes. During the first few levels on the beginner server, the game is fun but it's ruined by ball hogs and people who don't understand the sport or the game at all. I think out of 50+ Matches I had in the beginner server, very very few of the matches were competitive. Either your team stomped the other team or your team got stomped because you were paired up with people who didnt understand the fundamentals to the game (would try to do half court shots with a C, SG's would just stay under the rim for a rebound) But the games that were closer in score were actually really fun. Once you're fresh out of the beginner server, thats when the game gets even worse, you still have people who don't understand the game at all but not only that, you are matched up against people who have unlocked very strong skills that you don't have access to until you grind out several dozen matches. These skills literally make the player exponentionally overpowered compared to the skills you have when you are a fresh level 12 (Alley-Oop spam, Back Step dribble, etc.) So you have to endure through these matches because more often then not, you will be paired up with people still learning the game and have no idea how to play against teams that are already overpowered so they resort to afk exp farming. That alone is abused like heck, people just matches just to afk and get the match experience because they know they will most likely lose to higher level players. I'd love to recommend the game because it can be really fun, but it just gets worse until you get to much higher level and everyone balances out and the game becomes more skill based. But enduring the grind of the early levels coupled with players that don't understand the game and the afk farm, just ruins it all for me.

												UPDATE!!!!!!!!!! --- It seems someone else noticed what i wrote below. They implemented 2 new channels, of which one is for real rookies without lvl 12 char in account only. This seems very wise and good decision. Unfortunately i allready have a char above 12.....(which is ridicoulisly fast achieveable.)OLD VERSIONS CRITIC:Game mechanics and stuff others may explain. Basically theres 3 "tiers" "leagues" for competive mode, which is the main event of this game, allthough you can play with and vs AI. I recommend AI-Game-Mode but the competive mode, the main dish so to say, sucks. I will explain. 1. This game is PAY 2 WIN, At first you might not see it directly but in later game you notice it is. The 3 Tiers are Rookie, Major and Pro. Rookie League: Either real noobs like you and me, with different outcome and so on. +Pro's with their new characters. In Rookie League some of them say stuff like "OMG OMG WORST SF EVER" "LEARN TO PLAY!" and many many harsh things. They dont bother to explain what exactly you did wrong and so on.  Even if you are C and they are SG and you dont manage to rebound EVERY ball, just maybe 50-60% it can happen easily that they start to flame. In Rookie League. Without asking your level or experience. Without explaining, without giving help.  If you manage to hit lvl 12 quick, which is easy done, the heat is on. Major League. If you mess up here, be prepared to see many censored lines^^ Next thing: Even on EU Server, you see many many Russians. And they as unfriendly as a drunk russian could be.If you dont want to sink lots of cash into the game, dont have many friends you can form a crew with and learn together with and as good as allways play together or have a thick fur or dont plan to play further than Rookie or Major League, stay away from this game. Call a friend. Play ball in RL. You might not dunk, but you might be able to end the next guy who flames you without reason or explanation.  Had fun for  a week of exstensive playtime, but that community is the worst i ever encountered.

content:
Posted: August 1, 2015
												Good game mechanics, clever concept, fantastic tutorial !!Would I recommend it? Absolutely NOT !!It is simply a PAY-To-WIN  game. Let me elaborate rather briefly.1) You can purchase skill slots to constantly have an upper hand, therefore no matter how uber l33t your opponents are, you have more options.2) You can purchase special game characters that have higher stats by default, so a special PF will always beat common Center under the rim. You will cap your rebound, they will still out-jump you etc.3) You can purchase cards that will make your character un-blockable.BONUS: The majority of players are from Turkey / Russia, two countries located mainly Asia whose players absolutely love playing in the EU server, despite there are 2 asian servers. This means ridiculous lag to players based in the EU.You will happily play the game at first and in the first 20-30 levels you will just give this the benefit of the doubt; then by the time you have learned the game you realise it's futile. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME !!

												This game all-in-all is a good game. It is free-to-play and not so pay-2-win. It still requires skills and good internet.The soundtracks are so catchy and the genre matches the game be can be repetitive and dull.The gameplay is very simple. Gamers who have experience in NBA 2K series would find this extremely easy to play.As for the characters, they are very cute and fierce. (I like Grace of Noble lol)The downside is, it is very slow to load at the start of the game and at the start and end of every game. It lags occasionally.Another downside is not everybody is speaking English, people usually prefer speaking their own language but I don't think that there's a language barrier, though. They prefer Filipino, Thai, Indonesian language and etc. (I am talking about the Asian server here) Sometimes it is an issue for them if you are from different country and their own native bad words are all around the shout-out area. Not a big deal, though, because the community is somewhat friendly too.As for customization, there are a vast number of equipments that you can use but you cannot remove the default equipment of your character for some reason. like for instance, the armband defaults.Another thing I don't like is the special characters are so expensive but I think it's okay because they are called special for a reason.I want Girls Generation (SNSD) characters to be released in the Steam version of the game too.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 20
												A comprehensive review of Freestyle 2: Street Basketball that covers problems that newcomers will not notice until 100+ hours worth of gameplay later.1. For new comers, this game is very fun, very appealing, very unique and very attractive. A free to play basketball game with cool skills and smooth animations. This game is very fun if you and your friends are bored and just want to mess around and try a new game. THis game will make you laugh and you will have a great time until you get hooked...2. After a few days of playing you start to get frustrated because you begin to lose even though you try and your random teammates begin to yell and are toxic at you. 3. The community in this game is very very small, as you can see if you search up Freestyle 2: street basketball steam charts. Averaging around 1000 players, and this is spread amongst a few servers: N.A, Europe and Asia. 4. This small community means you will play against the same players very very frequently. Additioanlly, many veteran players will create new characters so you are always versing the same players, just different characters. 5. The game is slightly pay to win. You can easily drop $100 on this game if you play it often. Players may spend money on clothes that give stats like rebound, 3 point etc. Or they may spend money on a gamble to obtain legendary card sets which provide large stat bonuses.6. There is a really really big underlying problem that is hidden to new players and that is the server imbalance. THe N.A servers are on the west. Any players living on the west (California) get ~30ms ping. If you live central you get ~60ms. If you live east(New York) you get ~90ms. IF you live in south america you get ~100+ms(A.k.a you're screwed and don't play unless you like playing in the past compared to everyone else). Having a low ping offers really really big advantages in this game. If you are a PG and you have 10ms, you can outreb a center who has 90ms. 7. Gamekiss is money hungry and always creates new events to make them profit, but never fixes bugs within the game. Events like "SPend 50$ and get additional items". Additioanlly, gamekiss frequently reuses events that have been created before but just with a different theme. Some examples include bingo, dice roll. And theses events encourage you to pay for extra dice rolls or extra bingo rolls. Some bugs that have been in the game for a long time that is never fixed is the F9 key. The f9 key resets the ball in a waiting room because sometimes the ball bugs and cannot be picked up. The fact that there needs to be an f9 key suggest that gamekiss does not really care about the game and the player experience. The ball should never bug out and need to be reseted. Additioanlly, there are many desyncs in skills. Players see different things happening on their screen compared to other players which causes lag blocks, lag steals, sliding.  And these desyncs have nothing to do with internet but rather the skill being used itself because the desync happens everytime someone uses the skill. (unless the coincidence is so great that each time the player uses the specific skill, backwards two step, their internet lags). 8. The match making is extremely unfair, and this can be due to the fact that there's a small community so you always verse the same players. You can be a lvl 24 with lvl 24 teammates versing a full lvl 50 team.

												Super fun in the lower ranks when you and everybody else are newcomers testing the waters of this interesting Free to Play sports title. Upon advancing into the higher leagues, though, it becomes clear that if you have any hope of remaining competitive you have no choice but to purchase upgrades for your character. Free alternatives for character building are available, but progression requires so much game time that there's no way to keep pace with players that have money laying around to buy clothing upgrades and abilities.

												The first freestyle street basketball failed because there was too much lag, too many bugs, too many toxic players.  This one will fail in time as well for the same reasons.  If you want to cheat in this game, all you have to do is download large files while you play to create a lag issue.  The opposing team won't be able to block your shots, or steal from you, or even escape you if you are trying to guard from their shots.  I have tried that tactic and it works every time.  Being an international game with no servers for each region of the world, lag is a very major issue.By the way, unless you buy one of the premium characters, you will go nowhere.  It is definitely pay to win.

content:
Posted: November 18, 2015
												Its a good game, however its a f*cking P2W. It always has been ever since it was created with Sierra, I been playing FS for a very long time. However, I will not be putting this as a negative review since I still play this game and will always play it. I just love FS. Don't my cons scare you, however take it in consideration since it's true. If you don't believe me play FS 2 for about 25 hours and then tell me what you see.Now here is the pro and cons:Pros:- Fun game when you have respectful playersCons:- P2W: Pay to Win, which is very true. For example: When you buy a special character, you get a bonus stats when you create them. So if you were a PF, you would get a bonus like 5+ or something like that.- LAGGY, most of the players are from other countries playing on the US server. When you ask them why they don't play on theirs, they say something like "Nobody is on the server, blah blah"- There are some good clothes in the game, however if you want to add attributes to them you can but they only last like 30 days or so. It wasn't like in FS, where some clothes you could pay to add attributs and it stays with you forever.- The freestyles are random and you never get to choose which ones you want like in FS. For example, if I wanted miller time for my SG, I would have to get Freestlye tickets and play the random sh*t hoping I could get it.- Most people don't know how to play at all, and also there is a lot of holders when it's the last 20 seconds.- The last thing, its a god damn PAY TO WIN. So, if you want to win a lot, you either do two things: First, pay money to get special characters, etc. Blah blah. Two: practice a lot and learn to PASS the ball, and use teamwork. I prefer the second option since in this game, it is easy to beat the special characters. And it's called TEAMWORK!!!

												Pros+Game can be fun when just messing aroundCons-P2W as ♥♥♥♥. You can do all this special stuff with skills, and apparently you can buy extra skill slots. So those who drop real money can do more stuff in game. Imagine a F2P MMORPG and then make it with baskeball, this is what you get. Oh, you want to do something like a hookshot or some other "easy" real life basketball shot? Yeah, that's a skill and you don't have it equipped!-Community sucks♥♥♥♥♥ They just ♥♥♥♥♥, moan, and act really rude. Nobody wants to help.-Worst tutorials i've ever seen. It teaches you how to move and shoot the ball. Seems easy, right? Well you get in game and lets say go for a dunk. All of a sudden you see a guy fly from across the court and knock you down mid air like he's ♥♥♥♥ing superman. I still don't know how people were screening. There's no god dam key bind page to see what the hell does what. -One of the worst UIs I've ever seen. It's clunky. It's confusing. It's horrible. 3/10. It's fun, but it's plagued by so many other issues, it quickly took the fun out of it. I was hoping to get an experience that reminded me of NBA street back in the day. What I got was this abomination that pennies and dimes you and tries to turn everything into a MMO feature where they can make money.Since there's no other basketball MMOs that are f2p here on steam, you minus will give this a try. Just be wary, if you're not willing to drop money be ready to be worse than other players.

content:
Posted: April 12, 2015
												The game is fun, don't get me wrong, but there is so much P2W aspects of the game it's unreal. It's great for a F2P game, but they could make money the right way and not allow people to P 2 W! There needs to be more modes; maybe a 5v5 full court action. Make the game more realistic and add some more physics and allow me to be able to block a dunk. There is also way too much to the game yet way too little, and what I mean by that, is there are stat cards and free styles and "magic" clothes that would give you the edge in a match. Just have normal basketball, that's all you need. Too little, basically what I said before, to where there aren't any game modes, and just there isn't much customization either, unless you wanna be a dragon helmeted nba player or a humongous black Jonas Brother. It's fun, but there's issues I'd hope and many others would hope they fix.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 14, 2016
												I played the very first Freestyle Basketball and then i downloaded the asian version of Freestyle 2 back when it wasn't available for the United States, and I had played it very often when it was available. The one hour I have on steam was to see if this game was still pay to win, sadly it is. When you make a character you get to choose your position and you get to choose between a few sample characters with different heights, if you PAY the game though you can unlock other characters that have boosted stats and are much bigger than you. They will always be better than you no matter how much you play, this game is slightly skill based but it is very much like an arcade game. Rebounds can be grabbed from the other side of the goal just because a player has a higher attribute than you, regardless of your timing and positioning for it. Most shots fall in this game if you dont block them, which if you pay, you block everything. This game has the potential to be so much better, especially because it is the only basketball MMO out there, but they are stupid.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 21, 2016
												Great F2P, even fun for people who don't play basketball. People say the game is Pay to win, because paid characters get better stats is NOT true. anyone who didn't pay can beat them, you can even win Paid characters from Daily log-in rewards (Not every log-in reward but I got a Noble from the log-in reward). The community is pretty toxic as well, But it is so fun to trash talk the other team when you beat them! Also very fun to play with friends, and sometimes random people but they can be rude at times. They could improve the loading time, the lag, and graphics. But other than that the game is one of the best F2P's I've ever played on here, and they always update the game!

number of helpful: 7 of 12 people (58%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 27, 2016
												Great  F2P  game for basketball lovers. Fun to play with friends. It's not  p2w (I repeat IT'S NOT P2W)  , it's  skill based  and the  timing  is important here. People are saying that it is p2w because of the special characters. Yeah they have 40 extra free stats to spend but they aren't impossible to beat and the events in the game are giving you multiple chances to earn those special characters (I have 2 and I didn't spend even 0.01$ on the game).Teamwork is essential in this game. Without teamword you will lose all the time!TL;DR:Pros:+fun to play with friends+you can win special characters for free+you can get almost everything for free+on every match there is a small chance for the game to be streamed accross the server and the spectators can vote for your team.+there is some sort of 1v1+the gameplay is smooth+there is a Club system with tournamentsCons:-there are some bugs-its rare to find a player who will listen to what you are saying to him-some people have laggy connections to the server

content:
Posted: April 5, 2015
												This game sorta stinks. I can't find a grasp on how the shooting gauge works. The MC is God awfully annoying, since all he says is "nice pass!" "oh you sneaky ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥!". Community is filled with stuck up tight-wads with too much bullplop in their ears. Megaphones (an all out broadcast to the server) usually says something from xXx__BALLisLIFE__xXx "heh rekt u #@$# pretty easily step up your game". I find these rather disparaging comments annoying.The rookie channel is, as a commenter said before, filled with pros, as people could not merge their old accounts onto Steam. Articles of clothing are merely for looks, which really shows if someone has easy access to their parents' credit card number. Rookie channel, again, has some people failing a layup or easily shooting half-court threes with no trouble. The game lags a bit, sometimes characters and the ball spazzing out, or having characters that are nowhere near the ball all of a sudden having it.The community, as said, is a bunch of stuck up tight-wads. Some people ball hog and just keep dunking. Others can't read English, as when you need to go for 3's, they keep making layups. Like what the crud bro.The swearing filter has a really low bar. Words like "crap", "crud", "wtf", and even IDK has DK censored into i**, assuming dk is short for "♥♥♥♥♥♥quot;. That really throws me off about this game.To summarize, a stuck up community, poorly optimized gameplay, really harsh swearing filter, spazzy characters and items. Also, don't forget really crappy random drops. Keep pulling blank cards. Continuing: megaphone abuse, and the somehow hated cell-shaded art. I really adore cell shading, so this game is looks nice. Then again, I haven't optimized it for my computer yet. Yet.Overall, game gets like a 2.5 out of 5 stars. Give it a whirl. If it's not your thing, then uninstall it. That's what I'll be doing.

content:
Posted: April 14, 2015
												If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

												If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												April 1st Review(04/01/15):Freestyle 2 is a third-person shooter, action, MMORPG, team-based, real time strategy(RTS), sports, simulation, godly game. No one should ever talk♥♥♥♥♥♥about this glorious, godly game. This game deserves a 10/10 especially in the support, options, and spelling department(do they have a spelling department?). Please, rate 11/10 and play game all day everyday. Definitely no BS and no fail mechanics like good-ping-to-rebound, late blocking, bs blocks, or bs shots. NONE OF THIS IS IN THE GAME. DEFINITELY ALL BASKETBALL MECHANICS ARE LEGIT. THERE ARE DEFINITELY NO HACKERS IN THIS GAME...Legit Review(02/03/16):After playing this game for 10 months, it is safe to say that the company who runs this game is complete garbage. They do not care about the community at all, and would rather look for the game to turn into a gambling simulator than a fun basketball game. They do not care about hackers, and let them roam free. I would definitely be hesitant about picking this game up, but I will still recommend it because I still enjoy it very much. For other folks who are starting out... meh.Updated(12/25/16):The game has still not moved the server to central, which cuts out an entire side of the United States from playing a big man. They have been "testing" where to put the server, but it has been going on for months now.Tl;dr:Game is an arcadey-basketball game. A gambler's P2W game...

												Freestyle 2 was a great game. I had a splendid time playing this game with my friends the other day until... the 8th of April, 2015, 3:30 P.M. PST. Once I logged in to play this wonderful game, I retrieved my gifts and coupons. Afterwards, I went to buy some clothing to look swagggy. To test the clothing in-game, I went into a Co-op room. From there, I moved around and TRIED to shoot. From out of nowhere, I could not shoot. I kept pressing AND holding D, but all my character did were pump fakes (was playing as Shooting Guard). I was greatly upset. As an attempt to fix this problem, I played as another character. Unfortunately, I still couldn't shoot. My final attempt of fixing the problem was to reinstall the game. Once finished, I logged in and tried again. I had my hopes up, but Freestyle 2: Street Basketball disappointed me. I still could not shoot. Please, developers of this game, fix my problem and reignite my dreams. Thank you. (^~^)

content:
Posted: May 29, 2015
												Played it for a week, had my fill. that's basically it. It's fun for a while but gets extremely repetitive and lacks any motivation to go on after you've customized your character the way you wanted. Of course, that's the case if you're not interested in rankings, tournaments and the like.    I haven't spent any money on it. "Loot drops" are frequent and, sometimes, they give you really nice items. However, I don't see how the game is "completely p2w" according to some people. You can only buy stat boosts with in-game currency and it's not hard to get if you play well enough and long enough.Customizing your character is really enjoyable and gives you a reason to play more just because you want to earn enough points to get that hat/shirt/hair.   My biggest problem with the game is the atrocious soundtrack. Of course, that's personal preference but in my opinion it was spine-chillingly unbearable. Awful Korean(?) hip-hop-pop tracks (guess it would be called k-hop, or k-rap, or whatever just so that its fans can distinguish themselves from others and feel "so original and amazing").   To end this - it's not a bad game, it's free and it can pretty much run on anything so there's no problem with anybody trying it. If you find it more entertaining than I did you can easily spend more than a week playing it. P.S. (Edit): I didn't expect to enjoy this game and was pleasantly surprised, so don't go into it with any prejudice.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2016
 WARNING! I DID NOT PLAY THE GAME THROUGH STEAM, BUT THROUGH THE CLIENT!  Sad. All the money I poured in. All the thoughts I had about future things I would be getting. Grinding and working hard. Took me a year to get to level 50, because I had work piled on top of school. Looking back, all I wish is that I hadn't. I wish I hadn't gotten hooked to this, I wish I hadn't wasted so much time on this, I wish I hadn't enjoyed playing games with my friends so that some miracle would prevent me from this disease.  PROS!  This game hooks you in once you get into it. The moment you see the flawless design, to the amazing slams and layups you could possibly pull of, you love it. I loved it; maybe I still do. Beautiful graphics,  not like CoD or BF1 or anything but y'know what I mean, haha.  great gameplay system, loads of fun with friends, customizability goes through the roof, etc. These statements make great points, but there are reasons why I don't recommend it.  CONS!  No mercy. Simply no mercy for new players. Thankfully, when I started there wasn't many players that would smurf in the first rookie channel, but soon after, it was extremely toxic. After you hit major-pro grounds, players will bash you for your playing, upon other things. If you look like a noob, you'll be treated like a noob. The worst part of games is a toxic community. To keep games running, you need a good community. Secondly, the game overall is P2W. There are things you can get that aren't pay to win, but to be the best of the best, you'll need to spend hundreds upon thousands of dollars on equipment. Clothes can get additional strengths to be added to them, which is unfair. Another thing that is unfair is that you can purchase physically advanced characters with "better looks" as well as stats, and another 60 points to spend on stats. There is unbearable lag, and the controls absolutely suck for beginners. They cannot keep players in their game what-so-ever. Some moves are absolutely ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, and said that some shots make it in and there are certain things you can or can't do. The only time skill matters is when you hit level 50.  Saying that someone saying that it's a P2W game because they suck is illogical. I'm not a bad player, and I'm not good either, but I notice when something is wrong with a ♥♥♥♥ing game, and I know when to quit. Go ahead. Get addicted, let's see how you turn out, because it's not like I didn't spend all night on this game and I'm just a 1 time player, c'mon now. Shut the ♥♥♥♥ up, seriously, lol.   End Conclusion I don't recommend this game to anyone without money. Lots of money. To keep up, you will need to keep spending. Even the top players know that. They know they've spent hundreds of dollars on a F2P game,  and I'm sure that's something they regret.  and they know they've wasted their time on a trash, disfunctional game.

content:
Posted: August 14, 2016
												Needs Eastcoast North American Servers. The ping disparities between players is the games biggest promblem (esspecially players who have or are willing to invest in the game).  The Game is mechanically pleasing, but the focus seems to be locked   on cosmetics and special characters  (which is fine to an extent), instead of investing in stability for an underserved portion of the community. The game is worth playing casually, but ping can potentially stand in the way of passing the treshhold of being from being decent to good-thus i cannot recommend spending money with 80+ ms. I honestly, dont recommend playing a PF,CT, C if your Ping is that high (not  because its not possible, it is, but it is not rewarding you will have to work twice as hard as westcoast counterparts).

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 19, 2015
												If you play this game it's gonna be frustrating if you don't have people to play & coordinate with on your team.  You have a team of 3 & you only control 1 character.  The other 2 are based on either AI mechanics that you have no say over, or other players in your party.  You can ask the AI to pass you the ball but they don't always comply due to the situation.  This game would be a lot better if you could control the AI members of your party.  Don't expect a normal single player B-Ball gaming experience for that very reason.  You need to make a team of real people to actually win games easily.  The AI won't do more advanced manuevers often like the ones they show you in the tutorial either.  They just dribble, pass, shoot.  Sometimes they won't even go for the ball when it's loose & they'll get it stolen when they have it.Controller support is also lacking.  No D-Input support, so you better have an X-Input controller.  Even then it's still confusing as hell because the game is based purely on Keyboard & you have to look up the button maps online to know what button does what.Graphics are good, the game is half-court basketball with official rules.  So it's a decent half court b-ball sim game. The music is probably the best part of the game.  "We be ballin'!"  I gotta say this soundtrack is really catchy & fits the game almost perfectly for an outside half-court b-ball game.Overall after playing this game a few hours (outside of Steam) it's a good game IF you have 2 other people to play it with, but since I don't have 2 friends to play with my experience was sour. The AI is mediocre at best & difficult to coordinate with.  If you play this game definitely play with friends.  If you don't have friends interested in playing it with you then you might as well not play it at all.

content:
Posted: April 13, 2015
												Ok, so where should i start ?1. Once you actually start the game you have absolutly no idea what you have to do, or whatever you actually can do. You just see lots and lots of buttons on your screen and noone is going to explain you what to do. Sure, the Tutorial teaches you the basics of the actual gameplay, but thats it.2. After some try outs you finaly found out how to start Matches with other Players...but oh wait...noone is gonna play with you, because youre a noob....and yes you are on the beginner server, but noone really cares, they just kick you out....constantly. 3. If you somehow manage to get in a game, and you are really about to play....forget everything you know about Basketball buddy...teamplay ? pff this is the internet !!! If you dont have the Ball right off the start, ull never gonna get it again...at least not from your teammates that is. Your only chance to get the Ball is to make some lucky Rebounds or Steals, but passing the Ball seems to be somewhat prohibited in this game. so yes, after a little more of an hour i managed to join 15 Rooms, got kicked out of 14 instantly, had 1 match with other People and never got a pass. All you gonna hear is " pass the ball " spamming from your teammates, eventhough they gonna ignore you once they get the ball. If you like this kind of " Ego-Imthegreatest13yokiddyeva " Game, go ahead and waste your time.

content:
Posted: May 8, 2015
												This is *very close* to being good. But it just isn't. It's clunky, the controls are somewhat uncomfortable and not smooth at all. Using a controller/gamepad should be the default, you'd think- but the game is made for keyboards and it seems gamepad support was an afterthought. The game is also horribly laggy.Every screen packs in as many 'look! buy this shiny crap!' buttons as possible. All that being said, I think you should still at least give it a shot, since it's free and can provide a little bit of 3-on-3 fun. But don't expect for this to be the 'NBA Live Online' MMO you've always dreamed of.

content:
Posted: April 11, 2015
												Okay this will be my review for FreeStyle2: (Opinion Based) <ReadAwayHaters>[Brief Introduction]i played the first version of this game back in my childhood and it was really fun although i am not a basketball fan freestyle will always have the top spot on my sportgames list until something comes out in the category but alas i will say this i am no fan of any sport games as i lean myself towards Roleplay and Mobas.this game died out on me as time passed because it wasnt really getting any interesting apart that my friends only played Ragnarok back then so without noticing i was drifted away from this game. ("10"? years) later [Maybe]i as a steam user check frequently on Free2Play Games and stumbled upon this game once more and decided to give it a try, i then told my friends about this gem of a game and sooner than we expected we were hooked to this game.if it werent for the competitiveness (and maybe) because i have fun with my friends i would personally set this game aside.and so 45Hours into the game i decided to make a review about this game, here are my Pros and Cons[PROS]<Competition>:: this game offers more than what you would expect and since it is a street basketball game each match will keep you sweating and shouting for better plays<Basketball>:: who doesnt love a good ol'Basketball game<Style>:: ability to choose what you look before going into a match to distinguish your character makes you feel great and awesome, who wouldnt want to go in looking fabulous?<Suspense>:: anything can happen within the match, i have encountered many times a great comeback<Reminiscence>:: remembering freestyle 1 and how far its gone is a great achievement for this game as i have never expected nor did it cross my mind to come back after all these years<Teamwork>:: you need 100% teamwork, so what if you keep getting those 3pts, hogging the ball will get you no where.i personally always play with my friends as we are always on skype to get better communication and coordination but playing with people you know you wouldnt need to say anything because they know how you play so all you need to do is give a signal and do the play<Something New>:: Mobas here and there, isnt it getting boring? FreeStyle 2 did the right choice to go on steam{CONS}>LAG<:: Yes, i am from the asian side of the world so most asians will understand my pain that we are having a hard time playing this game due to connection problems and sudden delays.>Elitists<:: you wont have fun as an SG i guarantee you that. you will be criticized>Unorganized Menus<:: its easy to understand and navigate BUT too messy in my opinion>Control Change<:: give us freedom to change these CONTROLS" http://steamcommunity.com/app/339610/discussions/0/618458030676990749/ " those of you who would like to support the Controls please bump this.[Other Concerns]-other than that i have no problem with the game.fix the asian servers asap.-This is my Review as of now. this may change or vary depending on how the game will turn out in the future4/12/2015

content:
Posted: April 3, 2015
												When I saw this, I was hoping for a competent street basketball game with some paid character customizations and some kinda gross paid stat boosts. What I found instead was a poorly translated storefront with a terrible basketball game attached.Best I can tell, you are forced to control your character with the keyboard rather than a gamepad, which seems an odd choice for a basketball game. The rules of the game (both in terms of the rules in the rulebook and the way basketball works) are implemented very simplisticly. For example, if you want to block a shot, You'll need to be sure you're in front of the shooting player. It's literally impossible to block a short from the side or from behind. It feels like a board game implementation of basketball, and, as much as I like board games, the beauty of video games is that the game can juggle as many rules and variables as you can throw at it. Board games have to be simplified because people have to manage all those rules themselves. For a game as dynamic as basketball, this implementation doesn't create a very satisfying experience.The UI is ridiculous. Every screen has dozens of buttons labeled mostly with cryptic icons. As a new player, you'll be given several reward items after logging in, but you'll have no idea what they are or why you would want them. In this way, the game is extremely hostile to new players.If there is any fun to be had in this game, it's well hidden behind a smokescreen of odd design decisions and mechanisms designed to get you to give them money.

content:
Posted: August 31, 2015
												Coming from a old Freestyle player, this is a nice little treat.My thoughts:GOOD:- Teamwork required.- Scoring feels satisfying.- Costumization.- Good latency and lag compensation.- Crew/Team Matches- Easy to get into, hard to master.- If you're good at the game in terms of skill you'll notice you beat people with a lot of P2W stuff but you'll probably lose anyways.- Achievement system, challenges, bingo, My Ball, freestyles and other stuff to keep you busy.- MVP Rewards, the player that contributes more to the game/team gets awarded for it even if you lose.BAD:- Leveling is slow.- No filters to sort out rooms.- The game doesn't kick players that just stay there AFK (ex. You open a room and stay with it open forever without starting any game).- No "click a button" Auto-Matchmaking to avoid room problems.- It seems like there's low playerbase some times.- A bunch of P2W stuff that you need to get better.- Menus are a little confusing for new players but you'll get used to it.- Should have a better introduction.- Servers have problems, be sure you play on your closest region or you'll find yourself DCing or having lag problems.*Overall it's really fun but difficult to get good at and understand how the game and systems work, give it a try!

content:
Posted: August 16, 2016
Freestyle2 is a free to play MMO basketball game which is both awesome and nerve-wracking. First, I'll get into the positives and then I'll rant about the major issues.To begin with, it's a street basketball, thus, it's played on one basket, there are no fouls, free throws, etc. Matches last 5 minutes, they have overtimes and replays. I won't be going into the details about the basketball itself because it's self-explanatory. Next, in order to jump into the match, you must pick a position and a character which is customizable to an extent. Then you'll be launched into a really confusing lobby screen with tons of options. You'll notice card sets, toys (mascots), sh*tload of events, etc.. Next, there's training mode which is essential for a newbie. You'll get a chance to practice every ability of your chosen position. Those skills, if not yet acquired, will be available to buy in skill shop as you level up. For more flashy jukes you can try equipping freestyles.So the main problem with this game from my experience is the skill gap. Once you get out of the rookie channel you'll be greeted by max level veterans with best skills available, proficiency and a sh*tty attitude towards newcomers. The community is so cancerous (most of the time) that only Russians in CS:GO can compete against them. The gap is huge and you'll be roasted multiple times and lose the majority of your matches, I can guarantee that since it isn't an easy game.Secondly, there are a lot of microtransactions which aren't just for a cosmetic look. You can get stuff like new characters with additional skill points, buffed items and other stuff which affects your stats and gives you an advantage. Though it's possible to get them without spending real money, it's pretty tough to do so.Lastly, there are many bugs, freezes and connection stability issues and they show up pretty often. Besides, many people state that there's a bitcoin miner inside the game files..  that's a first.TL;DRPros:● Fun gameplay● Challenging● A wide choice of clothes, accessories, cards, toys, skills..● Many events● Exhilarating musicCons:● Pay2win-ish● Many bugs, freezes, connection issues● Leaning towards unbalance● Bitcoin miner inside the game● Unchangeable character appearance except for clothes, accessories and hair● Crappy communityOverall, this game is fun and competitive but has so many problems and a wasted potential.8/10

content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												Hello All! I am known as Sinth, Cyntherea, BuckTucker and Persephone♥♥♥♥♥♥♥in this community. I have played the FSSB Series since its inception in North America.  History of Freestyle. [ http]In late 2006 I started playing the Sierra Online Alpha version when it hit North America. I was instantly hooked. The pace of this game and the intricicies involved in "Pro" play are what keeps me engaged.We cannot compare this version of Freestyle with the versions that came before it so I will review FSSB2 on it's own merits.Review:This is a F2P game. You don't have to pay anything to get started and you don't have to pay anything to be "pro".  Create your character: Power Forward, Center, Small Forward, Shooting Guard, Point Guard.  It helps to have a basic understanding of Basketball to understand what these positions mean. You get a few default characters, with different stats based on position. Their are "Special Characters" or SPC's that you can buy with real money that have enhanced stats. What some people fail to realize is that if you are a "Free Player", that means NOT SPENDING $$$, you get a FREE SPC at level 50. So, no. you don't have to pay to get a Special Character. People that play this game are gonna say, "♥♥♥♥♥♥♥Sinth/Buck what about having to pay for extra skill slots?" Yes, extra skill slots cost $$$. My answer is, that if you want/NEED those then you are already high enough level or dedicated enough to "need" them. You can absolutely play without spending money. I have several alts that don't spend a dime and do just fine.Now the the F2P/P2P thing is out of the way, onto the game.This is an arcadey Street Basketball game with cartoony graphics and has an urban flavor.  If you like fast paced sports action and have a need for twitch reflexology, then I can't recommend this game enough. If you hate childish, racist, ageist (I'm 40 years old) smacktalk... Uh... Look elsewhere. The community is harsh. Most of the community is 20ish... some older, most younger, and most very immature. Please don't let them get to you. Apparantly, IRL people talk trash on the court. I don't get it because I don't hoop IRL and haven't since the early 1990's...anyway...Graphics: 6/10-Cartoony characters, weird looking pets (pets give you + to attributes), odd outfitsSound: 6/10- I turn off in game music and run Pandora in the background. People like to spam their emotes... BTW guys... super annoying.Gameplay: 9/10- This game is all about timing, coordination and using skills wisely. It gets it right (PF's are OP but meh, I main PF), the classes are fun and true to their real life counterparts.Fun Factor: 1-10- It's not a lot of fun to play with a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. It's fun to play with people that at least try. Don't be an elitist and you will have more fun.I currently have 3 level 50's, 3 more toons in pro around level 40 and several other stragglers. Hit me up in-game and seek out Team Bruh if you are looking for a Crew (Club/Clan). I will be in rookie on a C, I look forward to seing you all and have FUN!Also: I have always played with a controller. I do not play with a keyboard, if you can... I am amazed.Signed,BuckTucker - TeamBruh

content:
Posted: July 14, 2015
												This is by far the greatest sports game that I have played that is free. The game runs smoothly and the graphics are fine. This game is a 3v3 street basketball game (as shown in the title) that allows you to create your own player. Although you can't change your character's actual body appearance, you can change their clothing, hair style, hats, earings, etc. You can develop your charcter however you want by selecting which attributes you want to upgrade and what skills you want on your player. There are some clothing and characters you can't unlock unless you have money, but other than that everything else is free. It would be certainly worth your time to try this game out.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 16, 2016
Product received for free
												I have put a lot, and I mean A LOT of time into this game, I've been playing it for over a year so I think I've got enough knowledge about this game to finally review/talk it. First, I would like to say that I have not spent a single penny on this game, not because I don't want to support it, but because I'm still a student with no job, so this will all be how it goes from a £0 experience. Now, this game is really fun, it has 3 a side street basketball where you play with people online, you can choose one of 8 positions (5 main ones plus 3 special positions which makes the game a lot more fun) I have dabbled in each class, the best for me being a Short Forward and a Swing Man. It has a lot of skills in the game, each class getting a different set depending on their role, but also allowing them to extend what they can do, for example, my main SF is also really good at passing and assisting like a Point Guard. You unlock these as you level up your separate characters, skills do not transfer between characters so every time you make a new one it will be like starting over again. Something else that doesn't go between characters is your inventory (Unless it's a character coupon) so everything you get with a character can't be used with another, which is really good as you can't make a new character but give them clothes or cards that a level 50 (Max level) character would use. What does go between characters is points and money (Points being things you get after a game and money being what you buy with real money) so you may be able to buy a skill (which use regular points) as soon as you unlock it instead of having to wait for you to get more money. What also is between characters would be sponsors (Being exp, points and VIP) which gives you a boost in what you get after a match. You can get these by either buying them or getting them dropped through one of the many events that take place. The main downside to this game is that I live in England but my friend who I play with lives in America, meaning that if we decide to play together, one of us will have to sacrifice some ping to go to the other server, luckily the account goes between severs so I can play in Europe server with my characters while not playing with my friend and level them up.All in all, this game is really fun and I recommend it to anyone that wants a basketball game to play with friends but doesn’t have a lot of money, but you can always spend money if you want. You can always win if you are good enough, so just practice and have fun!

Posted: April 30, 2015
												Good f2p game. I use it when I want some casual PVP.+ Game promotes teamplay. Pick'n'rolls, open threes, big guys spreading the floor, it's all there, and you actually get this nice feeling like in RL ball game when team play goes well.+ Nice position differences give you different angles of gameplay (don't play C or PF if your ping is high, you will suck at rebounding)+ Real money needed only if you really decided to go hardcore and need those extra skill slots.So if you like basketball and you're okay with this comix graphic style you should give this game a try.

Posted: April 30, 2015
												Good f2p game. I use it when I want some casual PVP.+ Game promotes teamplay. Pick'n'rolls, open threes, big guys spreading the floor, it's all there, and you actually get this nice feeling like in RL ball game when team play goes well.+ Nice position differences give you different angles of gameplay (don't play C or PF if your ping is high, you will suck at rebounding)+ Real money needed only if you really decided to go hardcore and need those extra skill slots.So if you like basketball and you're okay with this comix graphic style you should give this game a try.

content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												Absolutely NOT Pay2Win if you want to have fun and win. The only "necessary" spending total around USD20 on 4 extra skill slots in order to maximize gameplay potential. It is only effective when you are commited to go PRO (~lvl 40+), you don't have to spend a dime to be good at this game.Each game lasts <10 minutes (Forfeit option is available).The community should welcome players from all skill levels. Expect trash talking at higher level games (common phenomenon). Freestyle should grow for the better since Steam launch, unless the developer side don't accomodate for the expansion.I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys basketball or sports in general. Great fun!
