content:
Posted: July 12, 2016
												Every year, as soon as the cold weather sets in, my hands become dry and flaky. With flu and cold season in full swing, I turn to excess hand washing, which always strips the moisture from my skin. To slough off dead skin cells and restore moisture, I make a batch of exfoliating sea salt hand scrub and keep it by my kitchen sink to enjoy all winter long.Though it's perfectly acceptable to keep this scrub to yourself, it also makes a great gift to give around the holidays. It's remarkably easy to throw together, so as long as you have all (three) of the ingredients on hand, you can whip up a quick batch. It's a thoughtful, customizable alternative to store-bought gifts, and ensures you'll never show up empty-handed to a party or dinner again.What You NeedSupplies1 cup coarse sea salt1/2 cup liquid coconut oil5 to 7 drops grapefruit essential oilEquipmentDry measuring cups10-ounce glass container (I used a Weck canning jar)ForkInstructionsGrab your supplies. You'll need 1 cup coarse sea salt, 1/2 cup liquid coconut oil, 5 to 7 drops of grapefruit essential oil, and a 10-ounce glass container.Add the salt. Pour 1 cup of salt into the empty glass container.Add the oil. Pour 1/2 cup of coconut oil over the salt.Add essential oil. Add 5 to 7 drops of grapefruit essential oil to mixture.Stir the mixture. Stir all ingredients until well combined.Seal and gift. Seal the jar and affix a label or gift tag to the top.Recipe NotesUse scrub sparingly — about once or twice a week — by spooning a small amount into your hands, gently rubbing it in, rinsing it off with warm water, and drying your hands thoroughly.I tried (and failed) to wrap both ribbon and twine around this jar. (It was so slippery!) To save your sanity, just affix a label, tag, or bow to the top of the jar.

content:
Posted: September 3, 2016
												Waste of time. Ignore the fact that the initial loading screen takes 5-10 minutes for God knows why. Ignore the fact that the UI is dog vomit. Ignore the usual P2W tropes, because they are all here and there is nothing to be said for it that hasn't already been said a thousand times for P2P games.I understand this is "street ball" as the term is used by the community as an excuse for how terrible competitive play is. The actual gameplay still doesn't make sense. 3 Point shots are made 90% of the time regardless of how much Defense is on the shooter, so the entire community just dribbles for 20 minutes and chucks up the ball from behind the perimeter and it just goes in inexplicably. Defense is TRASH on this game. Most of the blocks in this game are goal tends, meaning the person can just swat the ball way after its already coming down towards the goal. You can do this thing where you try to square up to your openent with your arms out, but that does jack♥♥♥♥♥♥ as the offensive dribble animations are so jerky and sudden they will always have space to chuck up a shot with 90% chance of it falling. There is absolutely NO reason to put attribute points into any defensive stat. I'm harping on defense because if the game had it, it would potentially be competitive. But it's just, "Let me arbitrarily move around near my opponent and hope the tilted RNG will let their ugly randomly thrown shot that im contesting miss." I've watched games where everyone is pro-level and it's still the same. do ♥♥♥♥♥♥ dribble animation and toss ball from 3 point line.Calling it Streetball isn't an excuse to have severely unbalanced gameplay. P.S Community actually gets upset at you if you don't just chuck up 3's the entire time as a SG. You arent allowed to drive or take an open 2. Even if you make it, You get called a "Bad SG". Even if you get an offensive rebound near the rim they expect you to dribble back out over the perimeter to chuck a 3. Why are we even allowed to put points in other attribute categories, then? ♥♥♥♥ it, uninstalled."Steph Curry: The Game" gets a 2/10 from me.

number of helpful: 20 of 40 people (50%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												UPDATED REVIEW (07/07/15) :------------------------------------------------------About the games flaws;This game includes 2 different game :)a) before level 40, easy enjoyable, you can be Kobe, Lebron (you think so :)b) after level 40 when you face the real players including very high skill guys, very good teams, very heavy pay to win guys. You will be shocked after playing against these guys, you will think they are cheating, you will be frustrated, may be you will quit playing the game. Now you are the ultimate rookie by getting to this point.*  before level 40 this game may seem easy, but it is not. So after becoming level 40 and even being  a level 50, with good piece of equipment, you are so weak. (Put aside the P2W equipment, cards which some of the cards you can aquire with in game currency and events, but the best clothes are time limited, so you need to pay real cash to make them permanent.) The real problem YOU STILL HAVE NO IDEA about this game. Passing at the right time, finding the free teammate, when to fake, when to drive, when to shoot, All of them requires deep knowledge about the game play and big experience. Average player needs thousands of games to be a competetive "level 50", and for each different position you still need additional experience.* You need a good team, or a good crew. And the friendship mechanics, crew mechanics are awful in this game. So basic like designed for handheld basic nintendo.* You find a good guy, he knows about this game, so you be friends. But only with that position, you have no idea about his other chars. At some point you have 5 chars and you time to time play with each other like all the other guys who are into the game. So there SHOULD be a main CHAR NAME, so by only interaction with that char will be enough to communicate with players all other chars.* The Crew Function ( Basicly your TEAM, CLAN,...) , totally awful, as a crew master, you have so limited options. You can not classify, sort, you can do nothing usefull. You can only delegate managers, accept players, or kick players out of crew. You have to spend enormous time to have a good crew, you have to know each player well, that is not practicable. YOU MUST HAVE (as a crew master) ability to see player stats, I dont mean attribs, but total stats or monthly stats, as you can see yours. I think you can not even see the level of your crew members (LOL), you can see this during their application only. You can not see inactive players, as you can not sort anything. YOU CAN NOT assaign them titles like, ROOKIE, VETERAN, PRO or whatsoever to classify them, which is a must in a serious clan, crew based mmo.* The games lottery system, prize system so rigged. Lots of times you will get very piece of junk items like 100 points or even blank. If the system briefly tell you there is high chance of getting ♥♥♥♥♥♥ items IT IS OKAY. But you see the WHEEL OF FORTUNE for example, there is lets say 24 pieces, 1 of them is 100 points (smallest prize), you turn it 10 times and 5 times you get 100 points, come on this is BS! than put more piece and increase number of 100 points. This is like  slot machines with cheating mechanisms, casino wins all the time :)* Information given by the game, about almost everthing is SO SMALL. Like 3 point attribute, 3 point success rate, which one is what ??? Which one includes what, which is better ? NO INFO ! What about Tussle, who needs tussle , what is that, ??? So you will spend your valuable points on stats you will never need, because you have no idea.* There should be some graphical improvements like antialias may be?* There should be optimisation of network code. Still we have disconnects from match loading screens, match would not start for multiple tiries. Some lags which affects gameplay, a player 3 meters left of you can block you with the help of Mr.Spock with a teleportation.So final state of the game : Pros:+ Still Great gameplay+ Seems like devs are listening players after steam+ Some of the problems are sorted out after steam release+ Old the pros are valid from first reviewCons:- Still P2W.- Big gap after level 40 with high levels, gap with experienced or/and p2w players. - Awful friendship interface, lacking of an appointed main char for general relations and comms.- Awful Crew system.- Flawed lottery system.- Lack of information about the game (stats,...)- Need improved graphics.- Need better network code.OLD REVIEW:---------------------------------I have been playing this game during OBT. I have 1 level 50 SF, lvl 36 C, lvl 27 SG, lvl 5 PF. Also I had played FS1 long time ago. So do not mind the steam play time.First things first, this game is PAY TO WIN (P2W). With earned points you can purchase items, which will give you around +5 attrib, but if you purchase item with real money you can go up to +13 or even +18 (so this is the pay to win aspect of the game) (Also there is the toy thing which can be P2W)(you will encounter PG who can steal all your balls, really annoying, a balance issue much more than P2W although P2W makes them so strong at stealing)Aside from this, I definitely recommend this game, because it is SO MUCH FUN. You can level up to level 50 (final), and build a good player, you can compete with others (wallet warriors). You can compete with others by Team PLAY and SKILL.So if you have a good team, crew, friends. YES YOU WILL ENJOY THIS GAME.IF you like basketball, yes you will enjoy this game. BEWARE you can NOT be a jordan or kobe, trying so will gain you only FRUSTRATION. You need team play, if you are high level, with good items and skills, yes you can be KOBE :) , MJ not so sure :))PRO+ Nice graphics+ Basketball online at best+ 3 divisions according to your level, so you dont get smashed by high levels+ If you understand the game and be a team player, SUPER FUNCONS- P2W- Need somehow good ping- OBT players can be a bit unfriendly ( they do not have the patience for rookies, noobs)- Difficult to understand core game mechanics for a newbei (including cards, toys and GAMEPLAY)*- After steam release, game is experiencing lag which I have encountered 1 in a 50 games series during OBT. So this is an issue now.* A major con was the low player base, I hope it will change with steam, this game deserves it.OVERALL: 7.5/10  ( a great game, if it was not P2W, it would be a 9 )YES I DO RECOMMEND, no body is perfect :) BTW I see most of negative reviews is due to absence of SEA server ( so this guys want this game to fail, instead of earning money and starting a sea server)

(Put aside the P2W equipment, cards which some of the cards you can aquire with in game currency and events, but the best clothes are time limited, so you need to pay real cash to make them permanent.) The real problem YOU STILL HAVE NO IDEA about this game. Passing at the right time, finding the free teammate, when to fake, when to drive, when to shoot, All of them requires deep knowledge about the game play and big experience. Average player needs thousands of games to be a competetive "level 50", and for each different position you still need additional experience.* You need a good team, or a good crew. And the friendship mechanics, crew mechanics are awful in this game. So basic like designed for handheld basic nintendo.* You find a good guy, he knows about this game, so you be friends. But only with that position, you have no idea about his other chars. At some point you have 5 chars and you time to time play with each other like all the other guys who are into the game. So there SHOULD be a main CHAR NAME, so by only interaction with that char will be enough to communicate with players all other chars.* The Crew Function ( Basicly your TEAM, CLAN,...) , totally awful, as a crew master, you have so limited options. You can not classify, sort, you can do nothing usefull. You can only delegate managers, accept players, or kick players out of crew. You have to spend enormous time to have a good crew, you have to know each player well, that is not practicable. YOU MUST HAVE (as a crew master) ability to see player stats, I dont mean attribs, but total stats or monthly stats, as you can see yours. I think you can not even see the level of your crew members (LOL), you can see this during their application only. You can not see inactive players, as you can not sort anything. YOU CAN NOT assaign them titles like, ROOKIE, VETERAN, PRO or whatsoever to classify them, which is a must in a serious clan, crew based mmo.* The games lottery system, prize system so rigged. Lots of times you will get very piece of junk items like 100 points or even blank. If the system briefly tell you there is high chance of getting ♥♥♥♥♥♥ items IT IS OKAY. But you see the WHEEL OF FORTUNE for example, there is lets say 24 pieces, 1 of them is 100 points (smallest prize), you turn it 10 times and 5 times you get 100 points, come on this is BS! than put more piece and increase number of 100 points. This is like  slot machines with cheating mechanisms, casino wins all the time :)* Information given by the game, about almost everthing is SO SMALL. Like 3 point attribute, 3 point success rate, which one is what ??? Which one includes what, which is better ? NO INFO ! What about Tussle, who needs tussle , what is that, ??? So you will spend your valuable points on stats you will never need, because you have no idea.* There should be some graphical improvements like antialias may be?* There should be optimisation of network code. Still we have disconnects from match loading screens, match would not start for multiple tiries. Some lags which affects gameplay, a player 3 meters left of you can block you with the help of Mr.Spock with a teleportation.So final state of the game : Pros:+ Still Great gameplay+ Seems like devs are listening players after steam+ Some of the problems are sorted out after steam release+ Old the pros are valid from first reviewCons:- Still P2W.- Big gap after level 40 with high levels, gap with experienced or/and p2w players. - Awful friendship interface, lacking of an appointed main char for general relations and comms.- Awful Crew system.- Flawed lottery system.- Lack of information about the game (stats,...)- Need improved graphics.- Need better network code.OLD REVIEW:---------------------------------I have been playing this game during OBT. I have 1 level 50 SF, lvl 36 C, lvl 27 SG, lvl 5 PF. Also I had played FS1 long time ago. So do not mind the steam play time.First things first, this game is PAY TO WIN (P2W). With earned points you can purchase items, which will give you around +5 attrib, but if you purchase item with real money you can go up to +13 or even +18 (so this is the pay to win aspect of the game) (Also there is the toy thing which can be P2W)(you will encounter PG who can steal all your balls, really annoying, a balance issue much more than P2W although P2W makes them so strong at stealing)Aside from this, I definitely recommend this game, because it is SO MUCH FUN. You can level up to level 50 (final), and build a good player, you can compete with others (wallet warriors). You can compete with others by Team PLAY and SKILL.So if you have a good team, crew, friends. YES YOU WILL ENJOY THIS GAME.IF you like basketball, yes you will enjoy this game. BEWARE you can NOT be a jordan or kobe, trying so will gain you only FRUSTRATION. You need team play, if you are high level, with good items and skills, yes you can be KOBE :) , MJ not so sure :))PRO+ Nice graphics+ Basketball online at best+ 3 divisions according to your level, so you dont get smashed by high levels+ If you understand the game and be a team player, SUPER FUNCONS- P2W- Need somehow good ping- OBT players can be a bit unfriendly ( they do not have the patience for rookies, noobs)- Difficult to understand core game mechanics for a newbei (including cards, toys and GAMEPLAY)*- After steam release, game is experiencing lag which I have encountered 1 in a 50 games series during OBT. So this is an issue now.* A major con was the low player base, I hope it will change with steam, this game deserves it.OVERALL: 7.5/10  ( a great game, if it was not P2W, it would be a 9 )YES I DO RECOMMEND, no body is perfect :) BTW I see most of negative reviews is due to absence of SEA server ( so this guys want this game to fail, instead of earning money and starting a sea server)

content:
Posted: September 3, 2016
												Waste of time. Ignore the fact that the initial loading screen takes 5-10 minutes for God knows why. Ignore the fact that the UI is dog vomit. Ignore the usual P2W tropes, because they are all here and there is nothing to be said for it that hasn't already been said a thousand times for P2P games.I understand this is "street ball" as the term is used by the community as an excuse for how terrible competitive play is. The actual gameplay still doesn't make sense. 3 Point shots are made 90% of the time regardless of how much Defense is on the shooter, so the entire community just dribbles for 20 minutes and chucks up the ball from behind the perimeter and it just goes in inexplicably. Defense is TRASH on this game. Most of the blocks in this game are goal tends, meaning the person can just swat the ball way after its already coming down towards the goal. You can do this thing where you try to square up to your openent with your arms out, but that does jack♥♥♥♥♥♥ as the offensive dribble animations are so jerky and sudden they will always have space to chuck up a shot with 90% chance of it falling. There is absolutely NO reason to put attribute points into any defensive stat. I'm harping on defense because if the game had it, it would potentially be competitive. But it's just, "Let me arbitrarily move around near my opponent and hope the tilted RNG will let their ugly randomly thrown shot that im contesting miss." I've watched games where everyone is pro-level and it's still the same. do ♥♥♥♥♥♥ dribble animation and toss ball from 3 point line.Calling it Streetball isn't an excuse to have severely unbalanced gameplay. P.S Community actually gets upset at you if you don't just chuck up 3's the entire time as a SG. You arent allowed to drive or take an open 2. Even if you make it, You get called a "Bad SG". Even if you get an offensive rebound near the rim they expect you to dribble back out over the perimeter to chuck a 3. Why are we even allowed to put points in other attribute categories, then? ♥♥♥♥ it, uninstalled."Steph Curry: The Game" gets a 2/10 from me.

content:
Posted: April 2, 2015
												A good sports game must have fluent animations (or at least "feel" fluent) and tight gameplay in general. The problem is that everything is tight to the point of feeling stiff and the animations are clunky as all hell. Not to mention that dispite it being a PC game, it does not use the mouse and instead uses the arrow keys to move. THE ARROW KEYS. Whatever is included in the controls right now could have easilly been replaced with proper WASD and left/right click bindings. You might be able to rebind them, maybe, I didn't really care enough to notice.Anyway, animations; good lord they are terrible. You run like the floor is ice, kind of hovering in place even though you are clearly taking a step forward. Trying to steal is pretty much impossible. Even the AI which is better than the average player can't steal.At least the game has some nice music and it looks okay. Though good luck seeing what character is on the screen. They kind of get lost in the chaos of black lines around everyone.Also the UI is terrible and the tutorial is laughable..

content:
Posted: January 22, 2016
												♥♥♥♥ing terrible. This game is literally, NBA 2K games with a Play-Pay 2 Win concept. The gameplay is God awful, has a lot of bugs which the devs will not even look into fixing; characters you pay to unlock have extra training points which gain you  an advantage over the other players who beat their asses to level up by playing with un-♥♥♥♥ing-beatable opponents, by the way they also implemented new positions so now you can play as multiple positions in one character! So there is no meaning of PGs or Cs anymore, SWs/CTs/DGs and other characters make up for ALL of the original positions. The skill system is also really ♥♥♥♥♥♥, they make you pay tons of credits that range from 2000 to tens of thousands but you gain only 75-120 per match if you don't have VIP or the other boosters. Oh by the way, YOU CAN PAY ACTUAL MONEY TO UNLOCK SKILL SLOTS. Another thing to point on, you can get special abilities added to your ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ COSTUMES. These can be pass/steal/intercept etc. boosters and can also make you AVOID F*CKING SCREENS AND BLOCKS. "Oh, did you try to block that last minute shot? MAYBE I DON'T WANT YOU TO BE ABLE TO BLOCK THAT." There is also a "card system", which you can put different cards that boost your abilities by a bit in 3 different slots; offense, defense and talent. If you try to upgrade a card, you need to have 2 or more spray depending on the level of the card. You rarely get spray from boxes and gifts, and there is no way to get more other than, you guessed it, putting more credits to buy more spray which is damn expensive. By the way, I'm not somebody who played the game for a minute and left. I'm level 30, I played it enough to know what the minor and major issues this game has.Overall, I wouldn't recommend it. If you want to pour cash into the game to wreck newbies, fine. Go with it. Just keep in mind that you won't be able to progress really quickly unless you spend money.

content:
Posted: April 7, 2015
												Best game in history. Every aspect of it screams perfection. When you first open up this beautiful masterpiece, you are immersed in the environment by means of its superlative soundtrack, it drowns out all other thought and just fuels the roaring fire that is the desire to play this game. When trying to navigate the menus, you are bombarded by its puzzle-like nature, making the time when you actually figure out what to do so magical. The character create screen prohibits the majority of names which allow one's creativity to shine, not only this, but the process itself is complex, no tips are given which proves it to be not for the faint of heart. The gameplay is unlike that of any other game I have experienced in my recently unfulfilled life, every aspect is flawless from the minimal controls to the minute amount of dialogue, which permits the focus on the important part; landing slamming dunks. Being immersed in a 200 ping world makes every move count which just adds to its brilliance. For such perfection to be free of cost is unimaginable, as there is not a price in the world high enough which would stop me from enjoying it. 420/69.

content:
Posted: June 5, 2015
												IDK what it is, but this game has always been the most fun I had compared to even the 2k series, Live or any other basketball game out there. It is not super realistic, but it has so many moves and ways to customize a player that you build from the ground up. Its an RPG at the same time as being a great sports game. You feel like it is you at a park playing when you control your character, just very fun, very well done. The old freestyle 1 was great and now I am enjoying this sequel.+ RPG style progression mixed with sports+ Lots of cool skills to learn as you lvl up & items to equip for originality+ Great competition online vs. others & team work game- Pay to Win as you can purchase items to boost stats and buy special characters with money too- Ping is very important so if you are on East coast you cant rebound/block guys with lower ping in the west very easily, they beat you to the jump.- The Devs don't care much about their playerbase. Windows 10 took 4 months to get patched in, the only game I had trouble with and they knew about it 4 months too. No compensation or even a sorry to us.If they fixed ping and took away the P2W aspects it would be a perfect street ball game, how it is now, its a 6/10, but still recommend it to all bball fans.

content:
Posted: February 14, 2016
												With solid, fast paced gameplay and an excellent presentation that's easily the best the series has ever had, Freestyle 2: Streetbasketball continues its strong pedigree of great basketball. While the presentation holds down the fort, the inclusion of the Street Today and My Player modes, as well as the addition of the developmental leagues make an already good title even better. While the technical issues, such as the slowdown and the legacy problems with the AI and shooting are dismaying, they don't completely destroy the on-court experience, which is still strong enough to allow FreeStyle to hold the basketball crown for yet another year.

content:
Posted: May 25, 2015
												I young friend of mine begged me to install this so I gave it a go.It is terrible, right from the start with the ear-assaulting garbage music, to the incredibly frustrating and unintuitive menu and character selection screen that make you want to turn the thing off immediately.  Here is a little message for the developers: if your player selects some game mode (for me it was: tutorial) and wishes to exit that game mode, you should let them do that.  Typically this occurs by pressing ESC key to get to a menu.  In freestyle basketball you will not receive this courtesy, if you decide you want out, you are going to have to complete that tutorial.I somehow knew it was going to happen, but this was by far the worst gaming experience I have had in years.  There are plenty of decent free-to-play games out there.  This is not one of them.

content:
Posted: August 11, 2016
												This game is a garbage watered down mess. It is awkward as fk, and everything is automated for you, there is no skill involved like the original. It goes without saying about the lag since its international. Freestyles and other things make no sense, menus are ugly and confusing. Instead of getting an attribute item like in the original, you get "magic" applied to things. What the ♥♥♥♥ is that♥♥♥♥♥♥ There is no skill involved, or incentive to level, as all the advanced skills from the first FS are given to you out the gate (Like Freewill for PF) and you automatically start as a position, instead of working towards it. This game is such trash, stay miles away. Pray they bring the original FS back.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 17, 2016
												Freestyle 2 caters to both casual and hardcore audiences. The game's simple learning curve allows anyone to just jump in and start having fun. As for your main character, you get to choose from 5 positions (Point Guard, Shooting Guard, Small Forward, Power Forward, and Center).There are also 2 Competitive Modes: Team Match which is a 3v3, and Individual Mode is 1v1. Co-op vs AI mode is also available.If you’re a fan of basketball, there’s no reason you shouldn’t be playing this game. It’s generous, it gives you free stuff such as clothes and outfits on an almost daily basis, premium characters for free and an amazingly addictive gameplay experience to top it all off.

Don't expect even a semi-realistic experience like I did. This comes nowhere close to even competing with 2K.Trash/10 never playing again.

content:
Posted: May 7, 2015
												After getting up to lvl 15, I have only this to say.Fun game, try it, but never, EVER... Try to block me.Your ankles will be broken.*REAL REVIEW*Don't ge me wrong. This game isn't your average Basketball game *cough 2K13-15 cough*So If you are not used to the way the controls are set up, It's a game where the mouse is not at all required during a match. It would be useful to use the scroll as a shoot/hold button. But this game does have VERY LITTLE flaws. One flaw is the servers when in a 3V3. And other is the way when ever someone drives and you just see this blur. Oh wait... it's call KISS MY FAST! To be honest, If this was on all consoles *INCLUDING WII U, STOP DENYING* It would be another game to have fun with the family. And if you're black..."AWW COME ON MAN! YOUR CENTER STRAIGHT GOALTENDING LIKE A ♥♥♥♥♥ DAWG!"There is no reason anyone shouldn't be enjoying this game. If you don't have it, I have only one question for you:Can you hoop?

content:
Posted: April 30, 2015
												Well this game is pretty good but...There are some issues. It being focused on Team play mainly is pretty good but you know, you get those ball hogs that don't pass when you're open... facepalm. Anyway this game is good with 2 other friends, other than that there isn't more problems, its a great and fun game, pretty grind fested BUT though it might be grindy its still very enjoyable and not that boring. The only MASSIVE issue I have other than the team mates which isn't so bad is the lag. And its pretty dang big. I live in Australia so I have to play on the Asian servers since I get the best ping. I thought having 170 ping was good, nope. If you have over like 80 ping you can barely do good. Well I am not to sure about under 100 ping but over 100 its horrible. You get blocked on your shot all the time, even if you're open for a split second, INSTANT block EVEN THOUGH you shouldn't of been blocked. Same goes for rebounding, person has better ping they'll get it.So in the end its a great game but the ping and teammates is the only horrible part. PLEASE GET AN OCEANIC SERVER!

												I have been playing this game since 2008 when it was still fs1 and i have good memories with this game, too bad we had to let go of our server and had to switch to a international server so we had hard time to cope up with the nations with faster internet speed, this game is not really a pay to win game, because you can get SPC characters and rare stuff with green item balls that you normally get after completing achievements and by logging in everyday for events. number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 25, 2015
												I young friend of mine begged me to install this so I gave it a go.It is terrible, right from the start with the ear-assaulting garbage music, to the incredibly frustrating and unintuitive menu and character selection screen that make you want to turn the thing off immediately.  Here is a little message for the developers: if your player selects some game mode (for me it was: tutorial) and wishes to exit that game mode, you should let them do that.  Typically this occurs by pressing ESC key to get to a menu.  In freestyle basketball you will not receive this courtesy, if you decide you want out, you are going to have to complete that tutorial.I somehow knew it was going to happen, but this was by far the worst gaming experience I have had in years.  There are plenty of decent free-to-play games out there.  This is not one of them.

content:
Posted: November 16, 2016
												Nice game ... pay to win ?!  I have almost 1.000 hours in these game.I have just 2 max lvl characters ( lvl 50 ) and that cuz I play only with PG , I have a lvl 50 SG and PG the SG its a normal character , he was the first lvl 50 character i make. When i make my SG lvl 50 Freestyle2: Street Basketball give me a SPC cuppon ( Specia character , u can pay for it too , i make my PG).  When Ace of Wulin team appeared was an event with a rulette ( something like that ) and I was lucky and I get a SPC ( I got my sf cloud ).  On Freestyle2: Street Basketball 2nd anniversary I get a free SPC from Noble( gift for all players ( Ty Freestyle2: Street Basketball ♥) ) I make a C ( Center ).  And these week I make king of Steal ( title ) on my pg and I get 10 green basketballs to open , I go to open them and guess what ... I got other SPC and I make a SG cuz i wanted to buy a SPC sg but now i win it.  Why i keep playing Freestyle2: Street Basketball ???-Great Updates.-Every time events.-Bugs ? Press F9 ( if u are in FreeRoom ).-Replay value.  Bad thinks about Freestyle2: Street Basketball ???-If u want to be a good rebounder u need good PING.-If u want to start playing these game now its hard cuz good players everywhere.  Freestyle2: Street Basketball Its my favorite game I bought CS:GO but Freestyle2: Street Basketball its better in my opinion . So if u want to play these game i recommend you to do it , u have a lot of content and weekly Updates and NOT pay to win ... skill to win.I love FreeStyle and FreeStyle community ( and DBLL Don't judge me :D )   Main name YoALEXpg50 ( I'm just good not pro :) )  Sorry for my English I'm from romania.

content:
Posted: April 3, 2015
												What is freestyle online?It's when you lose because of pure luck(korean random)...Its when you win because of one single opponents mistake...It's when you win by 30 and yout teammate disconnects giving you an L...It's when you are doing your best to win and are afraid of every mistake...It's when you get an SP1 card set for a point guard...But it's when you play and enjoy it!When you are always in game if your opponents are good!When you cooperate with your teammates as much as you can!When your skill decides more than your money!When you only can trust your mates and help them to improve!When you have to use all your sences to predict opponents movement!When you need to make opponents move like ypu want them to!When there is no time for crying and only time for a great game!It's just where amazing happens.... And you and your team are making it happen..Play this game and enjoy it!

And yes I know it's 50% skill, 40% P2W & 10% luck but still it should be 75% skill & 25% luck.

number of helpful: 11 of 24 people (46%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												I'm just going to go straight into it. I've put in about 30 or so hours into this game and I have enjoyed my time spent with it for the most part.Freestyle 2 is a basketball game that is published by Joycity and hosted by Gamekiss. The game is run on a free 2 play model and while that may raise red flags for some, I've found it to be very fun and fair. After logging in, you are able to pick from a couple of classes. Small Forward, Point Forward, Center, Shot Guard, etc. After choosing a class, you are shown a list of different characters, that are really just chosen based on your preferred look or style. The game doesn't really offer any body customization like skin color, hair, eyes. But you can purchase different clothes, wigs, etc in the game shop. (They actually have a decent selection for the ingame free points that can be earned through playing.)~Gameplay~I've found the mechanics of this game to be enjoyable, they all work how I'd expect. The controls definately took some getting used to. It's been a long time since I've used my keyboads directional keys. The A button is to drive dribble, which consumes stamina and allows you to dash with the ball to pass your opponent.S is to pass or stealD is to shoot or blockW is to guard or post up. (Moving towards the basket with ball in a slower and more defensive motion.I've found that it's a little bit harder to play defense than offense, but it all works well and feels really good when you dunk on an oppenent and he/she is slammed back down. Your character(s) also have stats and level up. Level 50 is the max and the progression can be a bit slow after level 30. You put points into various attributes like 3 pt, layup, middle shot, speed, stamina, etc. The stats feel somewhat minor and it take's a bit to really notice a big difference. You can also buy skills and this opens up the game to a lot more, making it faster and way more interesting. One of the skills I received allows me to drive dribble back and forth to really shake up my opponents. I find the gameplay extremely enjoyable and for that alone, I can reccommend this game to just about anyone especcially if you have friends, but we will get to that.~Graphics~The game looks nice. It's a very simple cel shaded style and it runs pretty well on most low end computers that I've played on as well.  If you turn up the game to high/medium, you may notice the game having a blurry effect on the characters. I personally didn't like this effect and found the game to look better on low. You only have preset graphic selections of low, medium, and high, so I found no way to turn it off. Speaking of which, I should probably talk about the options menu a bit more.You cannot rebind your keys for drive dribble, pass, shoot, steal, or your movement. I found that to be a bit silly in a pc only game. Also no controller support, but they offer a guide on the site's forums that is stickied and it explains how to use a controller. This is still not a good thing in my opinion and hopefully they will add more options in the future, but I don't see it happening.~Sound~The music is different to say the least. It's like k pop mixed with rap. I personally liked it and at times found it hilarious, but after a while I got tired of hearing the same tracks over and over again and listened to some of my own music.~Community~Disclaimer: Another persons experience may differ from mine.So the community is pretty small, but you should not have an issue finding any games. Though, I must reccommend playing with friends. Usually in a small community, you would expect players to be a bit more tight-knit, but that is far from the case. There are a lot of people that say the trash talking is just apart of the game. I can agree some what with that, but that isn't where my problem with the community really comes from.You will experience more♥♥♥♥♥♥talking from fellow team mates. Players will berate you if you just get unlucky and miss a shot. You may see people go into all chat and call there own teammates noobs, because they are losing the game. (You lose nothing important by losing a game except your winrate and you still recieve the same exp and points for losing or winning.) Edit: I can understand someone not wanting to see their win ratio lowered. I've done quite a bit of competitive gaming and sometimes communities will judge based on your win ratio and not your actual skill. It's just the way of the world, unfortunately.I have to reccomend that you play this game with friends, because it is an extremely good time with people you know, win or lose. ~Cash shop pay to win or not?~I've played up to level 50 so far and have not experienced any real need to pay. Though there are things to pay for if you want to min max. There are cards that can be found with either luck or in a gachapon that boost your stats by a couple of points and then can be upgraded further. Some may want to find the best versions of those cards that upgrade the stats they want. There are also some cash only cosmetics to purchase, but no outfits have an expiration date and as I've said earlier, I was able to find a decent selection for points and they didn't take very long to buy. You can pay for extra skill slots and that seems to be the most pay 2 win aspect, but from what I've read, you can make a  good character without ever paying.There are also exp boosts and such for conveniece and I've found the model to be fair and I don't think there is anything wrong with the system.~Conclusion~I can definitely reccommend this game to just about anyone, especially if you have friends to play with. You will have an easier time with the community if you solo que at a lower level, but once you get into the higher leveled games, you will see a lot of hostility from your own teammates. Other wise, this is probably one of the best basketball games I've ever played. It runs well and does everything I'd expect from it.

content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												CoopHoops Lvl 50 SF Shrewd Type Crew: BruhGood game. Do not quit the game early because it will be a bit rough in the beginning as a rookie because you will be playing with other rookies who may or may not have experience with the game. You can play 1v1, 2v2, 3v3 in (Friendly Match Mode) but stats and records are only recorded on 3v3 (TeamMatches). To be successful in this game you have to find good teammates. One man armies are almost non-existent unless you are talking about me. :) Learn the basics of the game and try not to spam dribbles because that will just make you look like a fool when you end up on your back in the dirt. Tips: Ping is a big factor in the game but it is still playable. Also use gkash on skill slots, don't buy a bunch of item balls because 90% of the time you will get a point coupon or something that expires after 7 days. Other than that real good game when you have solid teammates. Good Luck and Have Fun!

content:
Posted: April 5, 2015
												Freestyle2: Street Basketball   I like it.      I will admit I dont think I am very good at it at this time, but I enjoy what I have played.    Now that by no means its good to go, I feel its got some big kinks that need banged out before it gets popular.  Overall I enjoyed the gameplay, but A few things keep me from loving the game.- Ping, I had good ping most of the time, but if someone one your team is not running the game at 100 percent you are in for a bad time!- Cash shop I feel needs some work.  you should never get an actual gameplay advantage over other players from a cash shop purchase, that everyone else cant get with grind.- Bugs, I havent seen this mentioned by anyone else yet but I have encountered many.  the three best ones I have seen are the basketball hitting the ground so hard it shoots into the sky, after it was up there it got notmal physics again though so after like 10 bounces it started to get to a normal level again so someone could catch it.   Then there was the time one of the AI players got his legs stuck in the ground and could not move the rest of the match. or better yet the time the AI got the ball and ran into a corner and just started spazzing out, over and over again.  Fun times.    - Menues can be hard to  maneuver some times, I dont know if its a bug or im just not getting it but I always end up on the wrong "page"There are a good deal of positives though! These include,- There is adiquate character customization- The gameplay seems sound, I jsut wish there was controller support ( I feel this game could use it)- overall art style is pretty neat, not your average anime-esqueReally though I dont see anything that cant be fixed with a little time and patience.  there is a good base to work from and I like the art style a good deal, I just hope they make the changes the community want.  Another small note that doesn't fall in the plus or minus spectrum is that the community has a pretty good deal of all around A-holes.  The kind of player you usually only see in mobas! so be warned. Otherwise if it still sounds interesting after all that give it a try!

content:
Posted: October 13, 2016
												FreeStyle Street BasketBallyak sebelum masuk ke cerita inti..gue AFK588KatieNishimuraG2A a.k.a Thanrie Boniaga mau cerita dulu tentang game ini.. game ini adalah game basket jalanan, ngga seperti game basket biasa yang formal dan kaku, game ini memiliki berbagai Freestyle dan skills yang cukup beragam dan keren. Di Freestyle Street BasketBall kita dapat bertanding dalam mode 1 on 1, 2 on 2, dan 3 on 3.. sebenernya ada juga 5 on 5 tapi sayangnya mode 5 on 5 belum di implementasikan hingga sekarang, moga aja secepatnya di implementasikan biar makin seru haha.Dalam game ini salah satu yang dibutuhkan adalah kekompakan dari para anggota team tersebut. Karena dalam permainan basket, mau itu basket real ataupun hanya dalam game tetap dibutuh♥♥♥♥♥♥ja sama team yang sangat baik. Tanpa kerja sama yang baik pasti bakal sulit untuk membuat point, jadi dalam game ini tiap personal harus bisa menahan ego masing masing. Kalo gabisa maen kompak ya mending maen 1 on 1 aja hahaha :DMenurut gue game ini sangat asik untuk mencari teman dengan adanya fitur Club, disini kita bisa bergabung dengan club sesuai dengan yang kita inginkan. Biasanya ketua club membuat group di facebook sehingga para players dapat saling mengenal satu sama lain dan juga bisa saling sharing ilmu sehingga dapat menambah kekompakan dan juga skill para players.Game ini sekitar bulan Maret awal sempat mengalami beberapa masalah dan kendala akibat update yang mungkin banyak tidak disetujui oleh para pemain lama yang sudah mencapai title MVP. Soalnya sebelum update bulan Maret di Major ada 3 title, yaitu Liga Utama (level 16-30), All Stars (level 31-41), dan MVP (level 42-45) kemudian pada update Maret title AS (All Stars) ditiadakan dan diubah menjadi MVP (MVP jadi level 31-45). Banyak para pemain yang udah nyampe level 42 keatas yg protes tetapi GM pun segera bertindak dan dalam beberapa bulan GM melakukan update yang cukup membuat para pemain excited kembali yaitu open square,fame level, dan club battle. Inilah update update yang membuat para pemain Freestyle kembali merasakan tantangan baru dan peminatnya pun makin bertambah. Dilihat dari sini, pada beberapa bulan ke depan pasti game ini bakal jadi lebih baik lagi :DDalam Freestyle Street Basketball terdapat 3 posisi, yaitu Center (C), Forward (F), dan Guard (G). Setelah memasuki level 15, untuk posisi Forward dan Guard dapat memilih posisi yang lebih spesifikasi dan sesuai dengan yang diinginkan oleh para player. Untuk Forward dapat memilih untuk menjadi Power Forward (PF) atau dapat juga menjadi Small Forward (SF). Lalu untuk Guard dapat memilih untuk menjadi Point Guard (PG) ataupun menjadi Shooting Guard (SG). Tiap posisi memiliki kelebihan dan kekurangan masing masing

content:
Posted: May 8, 2015
												A few things about this game.Pros:Can be funNice stat trackerCons:There is a special character that is named Big Joe or some♥♥♥♥♥♥like that. Big black PF. His hitbox is GINORMOUS. As in, it's impossible to block his dunks. Like, literally impossible. It's an extremely ♥♥♥♥ing OP character. If you have one of these guys in your game, he's automatically going to win MVP of the game and you WILL lose if he's not on your team.The PF position is way overpowered. Even aside from Big Joe. The PF position is stronger than every other position by a huge amount. They'll almost always dunk over a Center. This game assumes that every single PF in the entire ♥♥♥♥ing world is LeBron James, which just isn't the case.If you're a C or a PF or a SF, you'll never hit 3s no matter how open you are. I understand that those position aren't usually used for 3s anyway, but you know how to make it so it's actually fair? When you shoot, there's an accuracy bar as in every basketball game really. You have to get the slider into the green position to get a good shot. On these positions, there isn't a green section. Make there be a green section, but make as tiny as my♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ There's no reason for the game to say, "Hey, you're not supposed to be taking those kinds of shots, so you're just gonna automatically miss it."When you get a "perfect shot" after hitting the green on the slider (hit the green, nobody guarding you, full shot quality), it'll almost certainly miss. Either take out the little "PERFECT SHOT!" graphic or actually make it hit. The game has Pay2Win features. You CAN win without paying, but people who pay money for cards are just bound to have better stats.There's a Skill called box out that can be placed on PF and C. If you don't know what boxing out is, it's basically guarding the basket to get a rebound. This skill needs a big tweek job in the game. If you even touch somebody while they're boxing out, your character will get stuck for like a second as they back up. It's enough to have the space to get a rebound against somebody, but making that person freeze for a second just for bumping into them is stupid as ♥♥♥♥. Anybody who has the box out skill is always going to get the rebound.The swear filter in this game is the absolute WORST I've ever seen. It's bad enough that the developers think they're our parents by having us not swear, but to censor things like "pass, idk, etc." is stupid. Just get rid of the swear filter altogether or make is optional. It's not that ♥♥♥♥ing hard to do. The announcer in the game SAYS words that are filtered in chat. This is a team game. Maybe have the ability to use the mic or something. Communicating with the team is a horrible pain because of the swear filter.The menu on the game is terrible too. You have to learn how to use it and where things are located by doing it. The game gives no explanation about cards, freestyles, skills, etc. When applying attributes to your character, the developers need to have it to where when scrolling over the name of the attribute, it gives an explanation about what that attribute actually does. You recommend that the PF puts there attribute points on "Tussle?" What the ♥♥♥♥ is "tussle?" Why should I put my points on it? What's it do?Most of the time, pressing ready with your team and going to the matchup screen will work. I'd say like 60% of the time it'll work. The other 40% of the time, you're gonna get stuck at 30%, which will take you back to the practice room with your team. That's a problem. If this happens to you, you won't be able to start a match again until the readied players unready and ready back up.Some problems with the community: Why the ♥♥♥♥ even press the "ready" button if you're just gonna go AFK as soon as the ♥♥♥♥ing game starts? You serious? Way too many people do this. If you're not ready, don't press the "ready" button. It's not hard. Some people lag badly when they have the ball. I'm pretty sure this is intentional. You'll be defending someone and it'll look like they're running to the sidelines, but when they catch up, they're on the other side of the court behind the 3 line with nobody on them. Easy 3... unless you're a C, PF, or SF, but I won't rant about that again.You'll get into games with people who will shoot the ball no matter what. They never look for the open man. They'd rather get blocked or miss it by 289371 feet if it meant making 1 out of 10 shots they put up. The problems that made me uninstall the game were the Big Joe character and the broken box out skill. I don't recommend anyone play the game until they fix a lot and get rid of the swear filter. You know, so you can actually talk to your teammates in a team game.

												Yang bilang gak tahan main game ini pada saat mencapai lv 24 ( Pro Channel ). saran gw cari temen yang bisa di ajak main 1 tim, yang mau di ajak kerjasama dan bisa saling mengerti satu sama lain. memang banyak player yang bacotnya gak nahan yang suka menghina player baru... tapi banyak juga player yang normal punya etika dan bisa di ajak kerjasama.  karena saya pribadi mengalami yang namanya di bully, di kick, di bilang noob, cacat, sampah, di suruh delete char lah. tapi dikarenakan saya punya banyak teman (di game) dan mau belajar dari cara melihat mereka bermain saya jadi tidak terlalu memperdulikan orang-orang yang gak berpendidikan yang cepet emosian *terutama bocah* yang taunya cuma mau menang dan yang bego di kick!.... So.....Saran saja cukup kamu cari orang yang cocok dengan kamu dan bisa di ajak bermain bersama tanpa memperdulikan kemampuan player masing" ( biasanya teman seperjuangan adalah tim terbaik ). TyFor people who not enjoyed the game when it reaches lv 24 (Pro Channel). My advice look for a friend who could be invited to play as 1 team, who would get the cooperation and can understand each other. Thats my Advice!. indeed many players his word is outrageous and insulting the new player ... but there are many players who normally have ethics and could get the cooperation. because I have personally been in bully people, get kicked, say noob, defects, trash, want me remove my char. but because I have many friends (in the game) and want to learn from the way to see them play, so I was not too concerned with people who are not educated are speedy emotions (especially young children) who just want to win and dumb kicked! .. .. So .....Advice from me is you find someone who fits with you and be invited to play together regardless of their abilities player "(usually comrade in arms is the best team). Thankyou.

												If you can see, yes I have played 64 hours, but ... I LOSED 64 HOURS OF MY LIFE ON THIS GAME.Yeah, rage review.SG=WinShooting Guards are too OP [Over Powered], because they have 100% 3pt shot... . PG is only from recovering balls and stealing them and in real basketball Point guard is from awesome playmaking and shooting. SF only have 2pt shots, ONLY. Nothing more. Center VS PF ... C>PF. PF in the character creation was doing a dunk, but ITS TOO EASY TO BLOCK BY CENTER. Center have easier dunks then PF. Just destroying every character with his weight ;v. PF is useless (Yeah, I had PF at 24 lv and its useless). Just buy by real money an extra character - Gorilla = instablock + instarebound.Why I giving a "NO" to this game? Because Pay2Win <3!Makers of the game likes money, everyone likes money but not on this scale!I was playing a match ...2 monkeys and one SG. It was Instant Rebound (2,10m and my character was something about 1,90m) and instant pass to SG. You was doing a dunk or shoot ... INSTA BLOCK OUTTANOWHERE. Gorillas plox.SG if he have items bought from IS = Insta win. 100% chance to 3pt, easy.Don't lose your time on this game guys, just buy NBA 2K16 on CONSOLE (Please, don't waste your money on PC version. Look at my NBA 2K16 review)Big NO from me :)

content:
Posted: August 16, 2016
												If you can see, yes I have played 64 hours, but ... I LOSED 64 HOURS OF MY LIFE ON THIS GAME.Yeah, rage review.SG=WinShooting Guards are too OP [Over Powered], because they have 100% 3pt shot... . PG is only from recovering balls and stealing them and in real basketball Point guard is from awesome playmaking and shooting. SF only have 2pt shots, ONLY. Nothing more. Center VS PF ... C>PF. PF in the character creation was doing a dunk, but ITS TOO EASY TO BLOCK BY CENTER. Center have easier dunks then PF. Just destroying every character with his weight ;v. PF is useless (Yeah, I had PF at 24 lv and its useless). Just buy by real money an extra character - Gorilla = instablock + instarebound.Why I giving a "NO" to this game? Because Pay2Win <3!Makers of the game likes money, everyone likes money but not on this scale!I was playing a match ...2 monkeys and one SG. It was Instant Rebound (2,10m and my character was something about 1,90m) and instant pass to SG. You was doing a dunk or shoot ... INSTA BLOCK OUTTANOWHERE. Gorillas plox.SG if he have items bought from IS = Insta win. 100% chance to 3pt, easy.Don't lose your time on this game guys, just buy NBA 2K16 on CONSOLE (Please, don't waste your money on PC version. Look at my NBA 2K16 review)Big NO from me :)

content:
Posted: April 2, 2015
												If you are looking for a free to play game, this is not the game for you. This game's cash shop offers stat buff equips and stat upgraded characters (purchasable avatars) so be prepared to dish out some dough if you are planning to play this competitively. So far the gameplay is a bit flimsy and feels unbalanced because the offensive capabilities of the players feels overpowering versus the defensive stats (the offense feels slimy and always gets through the defense). It is fun to play with friends and having played the original Freestyle way back, some of the mechanics are still in tact. All in all I was happy to try this game and re-live some FSSB nostalgia but this game is just not for me to play in the long run.

content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												I'm going to continually edit this review as I keep playing the game, so my thoughts may change over time/be incomplete.After my first match:This game is actually pretty damn fun. It surprised me really. I went into it with a semi-closed mind, but came out really enjoying my first game. Looking forward to playing more.After my second match:I lost the game by three points, damn. That was, again, really fun. I'm getting genuinely hyped over this and I'm really enjoying it. I'm getting slightly better at defense and shot/block timing, but I'm still pretty shoddy.After my first online match with a friend:Me and my friend decided to play the game together, so we hopped into an online game. We got totally obliterated. Practice makes perfect I guess.

content:
Posted: April 20, 2015
												Edited Review:After 1 year i just came back to see how's this game now.So far in my 1 hour gaming seems good, of course noobs are everywhere.Pros:•If you love sports specially basketball •Trample enemies on floor•Love to block bo*bs of female players•Good Music Fx•Good Graphics•Too many costumes (FREE if you keep on playing and lucky on draws)•I'm in ASIA server so community/players count is good.•Trashtalk all you can as long as you win (soooooo bad)•Donate cost too much so overpowered stats are very few.Cons:•Game Anti Cheat Program sometimes detect something even i dont have any software running.•Items cannot be traded :(•Not to mention you will encounter some cancerous players here•Donate cost too high for premium character but its ok, since they have OP stats.(only few though)-Overall its all about players view point if this game is good/bad. For me its fine, playable, good time killer, recreational. In short i'm having fun.

content:
Posted: March 7
												According to all known lawsof aviation, there is no way a beeshould be able to fly. Its wings are too small to getits fat little body off the ground. The bee, of course, flies anyway because bees don't carewhat humans think is impossible. Yellow, black. Yellow, black.Yellow, black. Yellow, black. Ooh, black and yellow!Let's shake it up a little. Barry! Breakfast is ready! Ooming! Hang on a second. Hello? - Barry?- Adam? - Oan you believe this is happening?- I can't. I'll pick you up. Looking sharp. Use the stairs. Your fatherpaid good money for those. Sorry. I'm excited. Here's the graduate.We're very proud of you, son. A perfect report card, all B's. Very proud. Ma! I got a thing going here. - You got lint on your fuzz.- Ow! That's me! - Wave to us! We'll be in row 118,000.- Bye! Barry, I told you,stop flying in the house! - Hey, Adam.- Hey, Barry. - Is that fuzz gel?- A little. Special day, graduation. Never thought I'd make it. Three days grade school,three days high school. Those were awkward. Three days college. I'm glad I tooka day and hitchhiked around the hive. You did come back different. - Hi, Barry.- Artie, growing a mustache? Looks good. - Hear about Frankie?- Yeah. - You going to the funeral?- No, I'm not going. Everybody knows,sting someone, you die. Don't waste it on a squirrel.Such a hothead. I guess he could havejust gotten out of the way. I love this incorporatingan amusement park into our day. That's why we don't need vacations. Boy, quite a bit of pomp...under the circumstances. - Well, Adam, today we are men.- We are! - Bee-men.- Amen! Hallelujah! Students, faculty, distinguished bees, please welcome Dean Buzzwell. Welcome, New Hive Oitygraduating class of... ...9:15. That concludes our ceremonies. And begins your careerat Honex Industries! Will we pick ourjob today? I heard it's just orientation. Heads up! Here we go. Keep your hands and antennasinside the tram at all times. - Wonder what it'll be like?- A little scary. Welcome to Honex,a division of Honesco and a part of the Hexagon Group. This is it! Wow. Wow. We know that you, as a bee,have worked your whole life to get to the point where youcan work for your whole life. Honey begins when our valiant PollenJocks bring the nectar to the hive. Our top-secret formula is automatically color-corrected,scent-adjusted and bubble-contoured into this soothing sweet syrup with its distinctivegolden glow you know as... Honey! - That girl was hot.- She's my cousin! - She is?- Yes, we're all cousins. - Right. You're right.- At Honex, we constantly strive to improve every aspectof bee existence. These bees are stress-testinga new helmet technology. - What do you think he makes?- Not enough. Here we have our latest advancement,the Krelman. - What does that do?- Oatches that little strand of honey that hangs after you pour it.Saves us millions. Oan anyone work on the Krelman? Of course. Most bee jobs aresmall ones. But bees know that every small job,if it's done well, means a lot. But choose carefully because you'll stay in the jobyou pick for the rest of your life. The same job the rest of your life?I didn't know that. What's the difference? You'll be happy to know that bees,as a species, haven't had one day off in 27 million years. So you'll just work us to death? We'll sure try. Wow! That blew my mind! "What's the difference?"How can you say that? One job forever?That's an insane choice to have to make. I'm relieved. Now we only haveto make one decision in life. But, Adam, how could theynever have told us that? Why would you question anything?We're bees. We're the most perfectlyfunctioning society on Earth. You ever think maybe thingswork a little too well here? Like what? Give me one example. I don't know. But you knowwhat I'm talking about. Please clear the gate.Royal Nectar Force on approach. Wait a second. Oheck it out. - Hey, those are Pollen Jocks!- Wow. I've never seen them this close. They know what it's likeoutside the hive. Yeah, but some don't come back. - Hey, Jocks!- Hi, Jocks! You guys did great! You're monsters!You're sky freaks! I love it! I love it! - I wonder where they were.- I don't know. Their day's not planned. Outside the hive, flying who knowswhere, doing who knows what. You can'tjust decide to be a PollenJock. You have to be bred for that. Right. Look. That's more pollenthan you and I will see in a lifetime. It's just a status symbol.Bees make too much of it. Perhaps. Unless you're wearing itand the ladies see you wearing it. Those ladies?Aren't they our cousins too? Distant. Distant. Look at these two. - Oouple of Hive Harrys.- Let's have fun with them. It must be dangerousbeing a Pollen Jock. Yeah. Once a bear pinned meagainst a mushroom! He had a paw on my throat,and with the other, he was slapping me! - Oh, my!- I never thought I'd knock him out. What were you doing during this? Trying to alert the authorities. I can autograph that. A little gusty out there today,wasn't it, comrades? Yeah. Gusty. We're hitting a sunflower patchsix miles from here tomorrow. - Six miles, huh?- Barry! A puddle jump for us,but maybe you're not up for it. - Maybe I am.- You are not! We're going 0900 at J-Gate. What do you think, buzzy-boy?Are you bee enough? I might be. It all dependson what 0900 means. Hey, Honex! Dad, you surprised me. You decide what you're interested in? - Well, there's a lot of choices.- But you only get one. Do you ever get boreddoing the same job every day? Son, let me tell you about stirring. You grab that stick, and you justmove it around, and you stir it around. You get yourself into a rhythm.It's a beautiful thing. You know, Dad,the more I think about it, maybe the honey fieldjust isn't right for me. You were thinking of what,making balloon animals? That's a bad jobfor a guy with a stinger. Janet, your son's not surehe wants to go into honey! - Barry, you are so funny sometimes.- I'm not trying to be funny. You're not funny! You're goinginto honey. Our son, the stirrer! - You're gonna be a stirrer?- No one's listening to me! Wait till you see the sticks I have. I could say anything right now.I'm gonna get an ant tattoo! Let's open some honey and celebrate! Maybe I'll pierce my thorax.Shave my antennae. Shack up with a grasshopper. Geta gold tooth and call everybody "dawg"! I'm so proud. - We're starting work today!- Today's the day. Oome on! All the good jobswill be gone. Yeah, right. Pollen counting, stunt bee, pouring,stirrer, front desk, hair removal... - Is it still available?- Hang on. Two left! One of them's yours! Oongratulations!Step to the side. - What'd you get?- Picking crud out. Stellar! Wow! Oouple of newbies? Yes, sir! Our first day! We are ready! Make your choice. - You want to go first?- No, you go. Oh, my. What's available? Restroom attendant's open,not for the reason you think. - Any chance of getting the Krelman?- Sure, you're on. I'm sorry, the Krelman just closed out. Wax monkey's always open. The Krelman opened up again. What happened? A bee died. Makes an opening. See?He's dead. Another dead one. Deady. Deadified. Two more dead. Dead from the neck up.Dead from the neck down. That's life!  (ง´• ͜つ •`)ง

content:
Posted: April 19, 2015
												If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

content:
Posted: November 12, 2015
												The game looks kind of fun, but when you actually start playing, you won't think anything is fair. The game is very harsh on beginners. The community ignores new people looking for help (I posted on forums several times asking different questions and was ignored) and the game makes winning matches impossible even with the beginner section of levels 1-11. Computers can be extremely easy but as soon as you play an online match, somehow the person's stats as well as all of his computer's stats are boosted so much higher than you, that his computer makes every 3pt attempt it goes for, and your computer misses every single shot it takes. Seriously the blocking system is so difficult that it really feels like luck to get any blocks. Don't even get me started on blocking dunks. The game has no tutorial on blocking dunks, and since the community doesn't care for new people, nobody was able to help me learn. Aside from the game being difficult, I can't even figure out most of the menus and i've played for a few days. I have no idea how to make my stats higher other than the 2 points from leveling up, yet they hint at the idea that purchased clothing can boost your stats. However you're supposed to do that, i haven't figured out. There's a lot of things i could complain about, but it isn't worth it since I can't see myself trying to practice this game. I feel like i've already peaked in my skill level, and everything is about who has the highest stats.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 30, 2015
												The biggest downside to the game, as you've probably seen, is the community. I'm willing to bet if the community was cleaned up, there would be much more positive reviews, but that frankly won't happen. So, the community is horrid.The community is fine with mocking other players, should they be watching them on the featured match thing, or playing with them. The amount of bragging and downtalking is unreal. If there was a feature to turn the chat off, it would be a blessing.Moving off the community, the game itself isn't bad. The game mechanics are rather solid, and the music (which isn't too bad, but can get old) can be turned off. Regarding the music, there supposedly is a surplus of songs, but for some reason only three will play in a loop, even when all of them are checked. You're given enough room to make your character look decent by paying with in-game or real-life currency. That said, the voices for the characters are near the bottom of the barrel. Seeing as each gender only has three voices, and each are decent at best, and pretty bad, at the worst.Shooting and defending are close to the same difficulty. Shooting can be kinda odd, seeing as the bar will sometimes mean literally nothing (you can for some reason still make a shot, if it's outside the green/yellow, and miss when it's in the green), or everything. Defending is equally weird, in that while it's done decently, it's not the easiest thing in the world to do, without a good deal of practice (like anything).Finally, the servers themselves can be sketchy. You may join a room, and have everybody ready up. You might find another team to play, only for the game to stop the loading at thirty percent and send both teams back to their "lobby". There is no reason I've seen for this, besides the game being kinda weird. That said, it'll normally go away, after some time.For the most part, the game is fine for what it is. The biggest drawback is the community, so if you're able to ignore the community, you'll probably enjoy the game itself.

												Am new to steam and was looking for a basketball game to hold me over until the new 2k comes out. Found this game and enjoyed playing it for the most part. Alot of character customization through either levelling up or different equipment. My main complaint with this game is that the majority of people on it seem to have no idea how the game of basketball is played. 3on3 usually dissolves into whoever spawned as the ball handler juking toward the basket for a dunk. No clear perks to any position, atleast not enough to make them stand apart. Overall a decent game, with alittle choppy gameplay.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 8, 2015
												TL;DR : Paying gives slight advantages which will increase probabilities of things like shots, stealing, blocking, speed, etc. but ultimately skill overrides all of this.  I have paid nothing, and still whoop players who have spent cash on this game.  There's a lot of trash-talking, but show me a competitive game without that.  If arcade style hoops is your thing, this game is really fun, and the price is right.Do you remember NBA Jam. or more recently the NBA Street series? This is an online, 3v3 version of those games.  There are no rules, no fouls, but it's so much fun and an enjoyable arcade style basketball game.  Just to address a few issues though:Some games have had lag spikes that are annoying, but most of the time fix themselves within 10 seconds or so.  Other times, there are glitches such as the ball being unable to be picked up, passed, shot, in which case you will be waiting for the game clock to expire, and whoever had the highest score before the glitch will win.Is this game pay-to-win?  Somewhat, but not really.  There are a lot of little stat boosts you can buy with money, but most of them can be earned by playing the game and earning in-game currency as well.  There are "special" characters which start with additional stat boosts, but you can also earn one of these for free by reaching level 50 with any character.  Ultimately, do people who cash have a slight advantage?  Definitely.  But no amount of cash can make you a good player, or let you win all the time.  This game still relies heavily on skill, predicting your opponent, and your general ability to play good offense and defense.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 16, 2015
												This game is soooo close to being an amazing game. It has everything you want in a F2P game: good gameplay, good graphics, a fairly decent community, and regular updates and changing events to keep you coming back.  However, it also has P2W microtransactions, the one thing that makes so many of these F2P so unappealing to people.When you start the game, you can create a character in any of the 5 positions in basketball.  You'll also notice that there are tabs, each one signifying the different types of players.  The most basic is just named with the same name of the game.  The other tabs have various "Special Characters" that you can buy for $15 if you don't have a coupon to make it free.  If you are new, you may not notice much different with these "Special Characters" except for a different skin.  However, these "Special Characters" gain a +40 stat boost that you can use at will when you purchase them.To put this in perspective, you gain +2 stat points every time you level up.  That means that if you pay $15, you can basically gain 20 levels worth of stats.  The max level cap is 50.  No matter how long you play, a basic character can never be as good as a paid character because of this, especially since this game's mechanics relies upon stat advantages and you can only be on specific servers for about 10 levels.  Even if you are a normal character at the top range of levels for your server, you will still be worse than a special character just getting into a server.You can be in a great position to block a dunk, but if you have a lower Tussle stat than the other character then you will be ran over.  The higher Long Dunk stat you have the longer range you can dunk from and the higher (vertically) your dunk is.  Needless to say this means Special Characters can end up dunking from the top of the key from a standstill, something that I have yet to see in real basketball.  The greater Middle and 3 pt. shot stat you have means that you'll have a greater chance of making the shot even with "Active Defense", the greatest defense you can have on a shot other than a straight up block.  This means that you can be all over your mark, but unless you can get a block you may as well not even be covering your man.  The game even breaks at a certain point when the stats get high enough.  The tutorial makes it clear that you can't block or steal from behind a player, yet I've seen so many "Special Characters" do that exact thing simply because their Steal or Block stat is noticably high.This isn't even taking into account the paid stat boosts you can get from clothing, the more stat-awarding "toys" you can buy with real money, and having the ability to get more stat-improving cards with real money.  Even the VIP system is broken, giving them extra skill slots, an XP boost, the ability to kick ANYONE from servers (including the host), and other minor tweaks.  Yes, you get a 50% XP boost for paying real cash for a VIP upgrade, giving those with money an even greater advantage.This is why F2P games fail.  You won't notice this at the lower levels, and you'll have some fun times, but when you get to the higher levels there are less and less basic characters, only leaving the specials to destroy the court.Regardless, if you can look past this, I recommend this game to anyone who likes basketball or wants to get into it.  To anyone looking for competetive play based entirely on skill though, I strongly urge you to look at other games and only play this for the arcade feel.

content:
Posted: October 21, 2015
												Pros:- easy to get into with a bit of basketball knowledge- first hours are really fun- if you get good teamplayers and go on a winning streak, it is really fun but..Cons:- ..but that nearly never happens, toxic community, lot of ego players, who only spam "pass me the ball" and never pass back and insult you anyway- the game supports this ego style because being open isnt as important as individual skill and outplaying your direct opponent- simple but sometimes weird acting controls (buttons have 2-3 different functions, dunk and postgame for example), different results in same spots and blocks and rebounds seem a lot like coin flips most of time, or i didn't play long enough to understand the mechanics.- lags are a huge issue, a lot of players warp around the court and score or rebound or get lose balls without the game even showing anything. it just happens.- terrible UI, lots of bugs, long loading times, the game hides a lot of information for example skills and stats of other players, which i guess is intended because..- .. massive P2W, you can buy toys, cards, skills, freestyles and clothing with bonus stats- no real matchmaking, you could get a team of 3 Cs who just afk or a perfect P2W team with a 5 game winning streak, both games are going to be no fun at all.Summary:It really has a lot of potential and could be fun, but the issues and the community are just to bad to keep playing it for longer.

content:
Posted: November 12, 2015
												The game looks kind of fun, but when you actually start playing, you won't think anything is fair. The game is very harsh on beginners. The community ignores new people looking for help (I posted on forums several times asking different questions and was ignored) and the game makes winning matches impossible even with the beginner section of levels 1-11. Computers can be extremely easy but as soon as you play an online match, somehow the person's stats as well as all of his computer's stats are boosted so much higher than you, that his computer makes every 3pt attempt it goes for, and your computer misses every single shot it takes. Seriously the blocking system is so difficult that it really feels like luck to get any blocks. Don't even get me started on blocking dunks. The game has no tutorial on blocking dunks, and since the community doesn't care for new people, nobody was able to help me learn. Aside from the game being difficult, I can't even figure out most of the menus and i've played for a few days. I have no idea how to make my stats higher other than the 2 points from leveling up, yet they hint at the idea that purchased clothing can boost your stats. However you're supposed to do that, i haven't figured out. There's a lot of things i could complain about, but it isn't worth it since I can't see myself trying to practice this game. I feel like i've already peaked in my skill level, and everything is about who has the highest stats.
