												If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.Eat.

												This is a great game for anyone who enjoys basketball, or a challenge. However, pay to win can sometimes be frustrating. Once you get past all the pay to win players, this is a very good free to play basketball game. There's people who play on the servers everyday so you can find a match 99% percent of the time. Most people who have down rated this game are people who haven't put enough time or practice to get the hang of the game. I have spent a total of 5 dollars on this game, and I don't even use the character I put the money towards. With that being said, yes this game is somewhat pay to win, but with enough practice, and a well formed team you can give any team a run for their money. 8/10 needs some balancing in the pay 2 win aspect, bug other than that this is a great F2P game.

												Let me start out by saying, this game has TONS if potential. The controlls are simple and easy to use, the gameplay reminds me of the old NBA Street  games , and there are a lot of cutimazation options for your character. So, where does the game fall short?The community is trash. Most of the people on this game hate playing team ball, and make 2k ballhogs look like Magic freaking Johnson. Me and my brother Played about 20 games, i would asy MAYBE 3 of those where with a competent teamate. I know what you are thinking though, why not just find a good 3rd person. Well we would but, the party system, (or lack of a party system) is just god awful and makes joining games a pain in the buttocks. Also the game itself is fairly frustrating, as there is little to no skill involed in the game. People will run left, right, left, and launch a 3. 90% of the time it goes.And i alos dont like the fact that blocking and rebounding are basically random.The game could be really good. If they would make a legit party system, most of my problems with the game would vanish. OVERALL 5/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 7, 2015
												I've been playing Freestyle2 for a few weeks now and its a great f2p game. There are many very attainable items, lots of skill sets, and a very cool positioning system. The gameplay is strategic compared to your typical sports game, making this game unique.  I usually put at least an hour a day into playing. There is a lot of content for a f2p game. The game can be a bit grindy, but it never feels as exhuasting as many other f2p games out there.The only bummer is the online in-game comunitee. For what seems like a relatively small population, the game is absolutley riddled with elitist, poor sports, and very immature gamers. It is a huge relief when you find a lobby with laid back players. I have no idea why this game glows particularly with nastiness, but it's interesting nonetheless.That aside, I still really enjoy this game, and it hasn't yet stopped me from playing it. I do recommend Freestyle2: Street Basketball for gamers looking for a great f2p game on Steam.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 8, 2015
												TL;DR : Paying gives slight advantages which will increase probabilities of things like shots, stealing, blocking, speed, etc. but ultimately skill overrides all of this.  I have paid nothing, and still whoop players who have spent cash on this game.  There's a lot of trash-talking, but show me a competitive game without that.  If arcade style hoops is your thing, this game is really fun, and the price is right.Do you remember NBA Jam. or more recently the NBA Street series? This is an online, 3v3 version of those games.  There are no rules, no fouls, but it's so much fun and an enjoyable arcade style basketball game.  Just to address a few issues though:Some games have had lag spikes that are annoying, but most of the time fix themselves within 10 seconds or so.  Other times, there are glitches such as the ball being unable to be picked up, passed, shot, in which case you will be waiting for the game clock to expire, and whoever had the highest score before the glitch will win.Is this game pay-to-win?  Somewhat, but not really.  There are a lot of little stat boosts you can buy with money, but most of them can be earned by playing the game and earning in-game currency as well.  There are "special" characters which start with additional stat boosts, but you can also earn one of these for free by reaching level 50 with any character.  Ultimately, do people who cash have a slight advantage?  Definitely.  But no amount of cash can make you a good player, or let you win all the time.  This game still relies heavily on skill, predicting your opponent, and your general ability to play good offense and defense.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 6, 2015
												The game is fun to play. It has...or had great potential to be a great animated basketball game. It makes you feel great when you can shoot almost consecutive 3pt or 2pt shots throughout a whole game, which could also be a problem when other players can do it too. The attribution distribution almost has no value anymore. I had a sg with all points given to her 3pt attribute (to be able to make 3pt shots) at level 20 and STILL have a low chance of making a 3pt shot even when the gauge is matched and I'm not marked. However, a pf is somehow able to make open 3pt shots more than a sg...makes so much sense. Also, tell me how can a sf be able to catch more rebounds than a center and pf combined??The game is pay-to-win. There are special characters with higher distributed attributes than the normal characters (very unfair) and the special characters also start off with better cards (which further increases their attributes). I know this since I had the chance to get a free special character during an event. So don't get mad when you match up against people with special characters and see that they're making 3pt shots in your face the whole game and not missing (*cough* SG...and PF... *cough*).The game community is extremely toxic. Everyone makes you out to be an amateur (noob) for not being able block EVERY shot from your special 3pt making opponent or not being able to catch a rebound over a tall paid-to-win sasquatch (not literally, but they're pretty big and one of the characters literally looks like a beast). It's either you start off as a pro in this game or face the consequences of being shunned for noobism. I don't know why entirely, but the server I play in lags every so often even when I have high speed internet connectivity. I assume other players from around the world join the server (e.g. Players from the Asian server joining the N.American server) and it creates crazy lag. It is irritating enough to go against a pay-to-win sg making 3's. Now you're going against one that knows how to teleport all over the court. The lag can get so intense, you would think you're watching DBZ - Basketball Edition.Anyway, I really did enjoy playing this game during the first few levels, but as you progress, you really start noticing the unfairness and unfriendly playerbase that this game offers.
